119.14: Obeying your instructions brings as much happiness as being rich.
119.15: I will study your teachings and follow your footsteps.
119.16: I will take pleasure in your laws and remember your words.
119.17: Treat me with kindness, LORD, so that I may live and do what you say.
119.18: Open my mind and let me discover the wonders of your Law.
119.19: I live here as a stranger. Don't keep me from knowing your commands.
119.20: What I want most and at all times is to honor your laws.
119.21: You punish those boastful, worthless nobodies who turn from your commands.
119.22: Don't let them sneer and insult me for following you.
119.23: I keep thinking about your teachings, LORD, even if rulers plot against me.
119.24: Your laws are my greatest joy! I follow their advice.
119.25: I am at the point of death. Let your teachings breathe new life into me.
119.26: When I told you my troubles, you answered my prayers. Now teach me your laws.
119.27: Help me to understand your teachings, and I will think about your marvelous deeds.
119.28: I am overcome with sorrow. Encourage me, as you have promised to do.
119.29: Keep me from being deceitful, and be kind enough to teach me your Law.
119.30: I am determined to be faithful and to respect your laws.
119.31: I follow your rules, LORD. Don't let me be ashamed.
119.32: I am eager to learn all that you want me to do; help me to understand more.
119.33: Point out your rules, LORD, and I won't disobey even one of them.
119.34: Help me to understand your Law; I promise to obey it with all my heart.
119.35: Direct me by your commands! I love to do what you say.
119.36: Make me want to obey you, rather than to be rich.
119.37: Take away my foolish desires, and let me find life by walking with you.
119.38: I am your servant! Do for me what you promised to those who worship you.
119.39: Your wonderful teachings protect me from the insults that I hate so much.
119.40: I long for your teachings. Be true to yourself and let me live.
119.41: Show me your love and save me, LORD, as you have promised.
119.42: Then I will have an answer for everyone who insults me for trusting your word.
119.43: I rely on your laws! Don't take away my chance to speak your truth.
119.44: I will keep obeying your Law forever and ever.
119.45: I have gained perfect freedom by following your teachings,
119.46: and I trust them so much that I tell them to kings.
119.47: I love your commands! They bring me happiness.
119.48: I love and respect them and will keep them in mind.
119.49: Don't forget your promise to me, your servant. I depend on it.
119.50: When I am hurting, I find comfort in your promise that leads to life.
119.51: Conceited people sneer at me, but I obey your Law.
119.52: I find true comfort, LORD, because your laws have stood the test of time.
119.53: I get furious when evil people turn against your Law.
119.54: No matter where I am, your teachings fill me with songs.
119.55: Even in the night I think about you, LORD, and I obey your Law.
119.56: You have blessed me because I have always followed your teachings.
119.57: You, LORD, are my choice, and I will obey you.
119.58: With all my heart I beg you to be kind to me, just as you have promised.
119.59: I pay careful attention as you lead me, and I follow closely.
119.60: As soon as you command, I do what you say.
119.61: Evil people may set a trap, but I obey your Law.
119.62: Your laws are so fair that I wake up and praise you in the middle of the night.
119.63: I choose as my friends everyone who worships you and follows your teachings.
119.64: Our LORD, your love is seen all over the world. Teach me your laws.
119.65: I am your servant, LORD, and you have kept your promise to treat me with kindness.
119.66: Give me wisdom and good sense. I trust your commands.
119.67: Once you corrected me for not obeying you, but now I do obey.
119.68: You are kindhearted, and you do good things, so teach me your laws.
119.69: My reputation is being ruined by conceited liars, but with all my heart I follow your teachings.
119.70: Those liars have no sense, but I find happiness in your Law.
119.71: When you corrected me, it did me good because it taught me to study your laws.
119.72: I would rather obey you than to have a thousand pieces of silver and gold.
119.73: You created me and put me together. Make me wise enough to learn what you have commanded.
119.74: Your worshipers will see me, and they will be glad that I trust your word.
119.75: Your decisions are correct, and you were right to punish me.
119.76: I serve you, LORD. Comfort me with your love, just as you have promised.
119.77: I love to obey your Law! Have mercy and let me live.
119.78: Put down those proud people who hurt me with their lies, because I have chosen to study your teachings.
119.79: Let your worshipers come to me, so they will learn to obey your rules.
119.80: Let me truly respect your laws, so I won't be ashamed.
119.81: I long for you to rescue me! Your word is my only hope.
119.82: I am worn out from waiting for you to keep your word. When will you have mercy?
119.83: My life is wasting away like a dried-up wineskin, but I have not forgotten your teachings.
119.84: I am your servant! How long must I suffer? When will you punish those troublemakers?
119.85: Those proud people reject your teachings, and they dig pits for me to fall in.
119.86: Your laws can be trusted! Protect me from cruel liars.
119.87: They have almost killed me, but I have been faithful to your teachings.
119.88: Show that you love me and let me live, so that I may obey your commands.
119.89: Our LORD, you are eternal! Your word will last as long as the heavens.
119.90: You remain faithful in every generation, and the earth you created will keep standing firm.
119.91: All things are your servants, and the laws you made are still in effect today.
119.92: If I had not found happiness in obeying your Law, I would have died in misery.
119.93: I won't ever forget your teachings, because you give me new life when I follow them.
119.94: I belong to you, and I have respected your laws, so keep me safe.
119.95: Brutal enemies are waiting to ambush and destroy me, but I obey your rules.
119.96: Nothing is completely perfect, except your teachings.
119.97: I deeply love your Law! I think about it all day.
119.98: Your laws never leave my mind, and they make me much wiser than my enemies.
119.99: Thinking about your teachings gives me better understanding than my teachers,
119.100: and obeying your laws makes me wiser than those who have lived a long time.
119.101: I obey your word instead of following a way that leads to trouble.
119.102: You have been my teacher, and I won't reject your instructions.
119.103: Your teachings are sweeter than honey.
119.104: They give me understanding and make me hate all lies.
119.105: Your word is a lamp that gives light wherever I walk.
119.106: Your laws are fair, and I have given my word to respect them all.
119.107: I am in terrible pain! Save me, LORD, as you have promised.
119.108: Accept my offerings of praise and teach me your laws.
119.109: I never forget your teachings, although my life is always in danger.
119.110: Some merciless people are trying to trap me, but I never turn my back on your teachings.
119.111: They will always be my most prized possession and my source of joy.
119.112: I have made up my mind to obey your laws forever, no matter what.
119.113: I hate anyone whose loyalty is divided, but I love your Law.
119.114: You are my place of safety and my shield. Your word is my only hope.
119.115: All you worthless people, get away from me! I am determined to obey the commands of my God.
119.116: Be true to your word, LORD. Keep me alive and strong; don't let me be ashamed because of my hope.
119.117: Keep me safe and secure, so that I will always respect your laws.
119.118: You reject all deceitful liars because they refuse your teachings.
119.119: As far as you are concerned, evil people are garbage, and so I follow your rules.
119.120: I tremble all over when I think of you and the way you judge.
119.121: I did what was fair and right! Don't hand me over to those who want to mistreat me.
119.122: Take good care of me, your servant, and don't let me be harmed by those conceited people.
119.123: My eyes are weary from waiting to see you keep your promise to come and save me.
119.124: Show your love for me, your servant, and teach me your laws.
119.125: I serve you, so let me understand your teachings.
119.126: Do something, LORD! They have broken your Law.
119.127: Your laws mean more to me than the finest gold.
119.128: I follow all your commands, but I hate anyone who leads me astray.
119.129: Your teachings are wonderful, and I respect them all.
119.130: Understanding your word brings light to the minds of ordinary people.
119.131: I honestly want to know everything you teach.
119.132: Think about me and be kind, just as you are to everyone who loves your name.
119.133: Keep your promise and don't let me stumble or let sin control my life.
119.134: Protect me from abuse, so I can obey your laws.
119.135: Smile on me, your servant, and teach me your laws.
119.136: When anyone disobeys you, my eyes overflow with tears.
119.137: Our LORD, you always do right, and your decisions are fair.
119.138: All your teachings are true and trustworthy.
119.139: It upsets me greatly when my enemies neglect your teachings.
119.140: Your word to me, your servant, is like pure gold; I treasure what you say.
119.141: Everyone calls me a nobody, but I remember your laws.
119.142: You will always do right, and your teachings are true.
119.143: I am in deep distress, but I love your teachings.
119.144: Your rules are always fair. Help me to understand them and live.
119.145: I pray to you, LORD! Please answer me. I promise to obey your laws.
119.146: I beg you to save me, so I can follow your rules.
119.147: Even before sunrise, I pray for your help, and I put my hope in what you have said.
119.148: I lie awake at night, thinking of your promises.
119.149: Show that you love me, LORD, and answer my prayer. Please do the right thing and save my life.
119.150: People who disobey your Law have made evil plans and want to hurt me,
119.151: but you are with me, and all your commands can be trusted.
119.152: From studying your laws, I found out long ago you made them to last forever.
119.153: I have not forgotten your Law! Look at the trouble I am in, and rescue me.
119.154: Be my defender and protector! Remember your promise and save my life.
119.155: Evil people won't obey you, and so they have no hope of being saved.
119.156: You are merciful, LORD! Please do the right thing and save my life.
119.157: I have a lot of brutal enemies, but still I never turn from your laws.
119.158: Those unfaithful people who refuse to obey you are disgusting to me.
119.159: Remember how I love your laws, and show your love for me by keeping me safe.
119.160: All you say can be trusted; your teachings are true and will last forever.
119.161: Rulers are cruel to me for no reason. But with all my heart I respect your words,
119.162: because they bring happiness like treasures taken in war.
119.163: I can't stand liars, but I love your Law.
119.164: I praise you seven times a day because your laws are fair.
119.165: You give peace of mind to all who love your Law. Nothing can make them fall.
119.166: You are my only hope for being saved, LORD, and I do all you command.
119.167: I love and obey your laws with all my heart.
119.168: You know everything I do. You know I respect every law you have given.
119.169: Please, LORD, hear my prayer and give me the understanding that comes from your word.
119.170: Listen to my concerns and keep me safe, just as you have promised.
119.171: If you will teach me your laws, I will praise you
119.172: and sing about your promise, because all your teachings are what they ought to be.
119.173: Be ready to protect me because I have chosen to obey your laws.
119.174: I am waiting for you to save me, LORD. Your Law makes me happy.
119.175: Keep me alive, so I can praise you, and let me find help in your teachings.
119.176: I am your servant, but I have wandered away like a lost sheep. Please come after me, because I have not forgotten your teachings.

120.1: When I am in trouble, I pray,
120.2: "Come and save me, LORD, from deceitful liars!"
120.3: What punishment is fitting for you deceitful liars?
120.4: Your reward should be sharp and flaming arrows!
120.5: But I must live as a foreigner among the people of Meshech and in the tents of Kedar.
120.6: I have spent too much time living among people who hate peace.
120.7: I am in favor of peace, but when I speak of it, all they want is war.

121.1: I look to the hills! Where will I find help?
121.2: It will come from the LORD, who created heaven and earth.
121.3: The LORD is your protector, and he won't go to sleep or let you stumble.
121.4: The protector of Israel doesn't doze or ever get drowsy.
121.5: The LORD is your protector, there at your right side to shade you from the sun.
121.6: You won't be harmed by the sun during the day or by the moon at night.
121.7: The LORD will protect you and keep you safe from all dangers.
121.8: The LORD will protect you now and always wherever you go.

122.1: It made me glad when they said, "Let's go to the house of the LORD!"
122.2: Jerusalem, we are standing inside your gates.
122.3: Jerusalem, what a strong and beautiful city you are!
122.4: Every tribe of the LORD obeys him and comes to you to praise his name.
122.5: David's royal throne is here where justice rules.
122.6: Jerusalem, we pray that you will have peace, and that all will go well for those who love you.
122.7: May there be peace inside your city walls and in your palaces.
122.8: Because of my friends and my relatives, I will pray for peace.
122.9: And because of the house of the LORD our God, I will work for your good.

123.1: Our LORD and our God, I turn my eyes to you, on your throne in heaven.
123.2: Servants look to their master, but we will look to you, until you have mercy on us.
123.3: Please have mercy, LORD! We have been insulted more than we can stand,
123.4: and we can't take more abuse from those proud, conceited people.

124.1: The LORD was on our side! Let everyone in Israel say:
124.2: "The LORD was on our side! Otherwise, the enemy attack
124.3: would have killed us all, because it was furious.
124.4: We would have been swept away in a violent flood
124.6: Let's praise the LORD! He protected us from enemies who were like wild animals,
124.7: and we escaped like birds from a hunter's torn net.
124.8: The LORD made heaven and earth, and he is the one who sends us help.

125.1: Everyone who trusts the LORD is like Mount Zion that cannot be shaken and will stand forever.
125.2: Just as Jerusalem is protected by mountains on every side, the LORD protects his people by holding them in his arms now and forever.
125.3: He won't let the wicked rule his people or lead them to do wrong.
125.4: Let's ask the LORD to be kind to everyone who is good and completely obeys him.
125.5: When the LORD punishes the wicked, he will punish everyone else who lives an evil life. Pray for peace in Israel!

126.1: It seemed like a dream when the LORD brought us back to the city of Zion.
126.2: We celebrated with laughter and joyful songs. In foreign nations it was said, "The LORD has worked miracles for his people."
126.3: And so we celebrated because the LORD had indeed worked miracles for us.
126.4: Our LORD, we ask you to bless our people again, and let us be like streams in the Southern Desert.
126.5: We cried as we went out to plant our seeds. Now let us celebrate as we bring in the crops.
126.6: We cried on the way to plant our seeds, but we will celebrate and shout as we bring in the crops.

127.1: Without the help of the LORD it is useless to build a home or to guard a city.
127.2: It is useless to get up early and stay up late in order to earn a living. God takes care of his own, even while they sleep.
127.3: Children are a blessing and a gift from the LORD.
127.4: Having a lot of children to take care of you in your old age is like a warrior with a lot of arrows.
127.5: The more you have, the better off you will be, because they will protect you when your enemies attack you in court.

128.1: The LORD will bless you if you respect him and obey his laws.
128.2: Your fields will produce, and you will be happy--all will go well.
128.3: Your wife will be as fruitful as a grapevine, and just as an olive tree is rich with olives, your home will be rich with healthy children.
128.4: This is how the LORD will bless everyone who respects him.
128.5: I pray that the LORD will bless you from Zion and let Jerusalem prosper as long as you live.
128.6: May you live long enough to see your grandchildren. Let's pray for peace in Israel!

129.1: Since the time I was young, enemies have often attacked! Let everyone in Israel say:
129.2: "Since the time I was young, enemies have often attacked! But they have not defeated me,
129.3: though my back is like a field that has just been plowed."
129.4: The LORD always does right, and he has set me free from the ropes of those cruel people.
129.5: I pray that all who hate the city of Zion will be made ashamed and forced to turn and run.
129.6: May they be like grass on the flat roof of a house, grass that dries up as soon as it sprouts.
129.7: Don't let them be like wheat gathered in bundles.
129.8: And don't let anyone who passes by say to them, "The LORD bless you! I give you my blessing in the name of the LORD."

130.1: From a sea of troubles I cry out to you, LORD.
130.2: Won't you please listen as I beg for mercy?
130.3: If you kept record of our sins, no one could last long.
130.4: But you forgive us, and so we will worship you.
130.5: With all my heart, I am waiting, LORD, for you! I trust your promises.
130.6: I wait for you more eagerly than a soldier on guard duty waits for the dawn. Yes, I wait more eagerly than a soldier on guard duty waits for the dawn.
130.7: Israel, trust the LORD! God is always merciful and has the power to save you.
130.8: Israel, the LORD will save you from all your sins.

131.1: I am not conceited, LORD, and I don't waste my time on impossible schemes.
131.2: But I have learned to feel safe and satisfied, like a young child in its mother's arms.
131.3: People of Israel, you must trust the LORD now and forever.

132.1: Our LORD, don't forget David and how he suffered.
132.2: Mighty God of Jacob, remember how he promised:
132.3: "I won't go home or crawl into bed
132.5: until I find a home for you, the mighty LORD God of Jacob."
132.6: When we were in Ephrath, we heard that the sacred chest was somewhere near Jaar.
132.7: Then we said, "Let's go to the throne of the LORD and worship at his feet."
132.8: Come to your new home, LORD, you and the sacred chest with all its power.
132.9: Let victory be like robes for the priests; let your faithful people celebrate and shout.
132.10: David is your chosen one, so don't reject him.
132.11: You made a solemn promise to David, when you said, "I, the LORD, promise that someone in your family will always be king.
132.12: If they keep our agreement and follow my teachings, then someone in your family will rule forever."
132.13: You have gladly chosen Zion as your home, our LORD.
132.14: You said, "This is my home! I will live here forever.
132.15: I will bless Zion with food, and even the poor will eat until they are full.
132.16: Victory will be like robes for the priests, and its faithful people will celebrate and shout.
132.17: I will give mighty power to the kingdom of David. Each of my chosen kings will shine like a lamp
132.18: and wear a sparkling crown. But I will disgrace their enemies."

133.1: It is truly wonderful when the people of God live together in peace.
133.2: It is as beautiful as olive oil poured on Aaron's head and running down his beard and the collar of his robe.
133.3: It is like the dew from Mount Hermon, falling on Zion's mountains, where the LORD has promised to bless his people with life forevermore.

134.1: Everyone who serves the LORD, come and offer praises. Everyone who has gathered in his temple tonight,
134.2: lift your hands in prayer toward his holy place and praise the LORD.
134.3: The LORD is the Creator of heaven and earth, and I pray that the LORD will bless you from Zion.

135.1: Shout praises to the LORD! You are his servants, so praise his name.
135.2: All who serve in the temple of the LORD our God,
135.3: come and shout praises. Praise the name of the LORD! He is kind and good.
135.4: He chose the family of Jacob and the people of Israel for his very own.
135.5: The LORD is much greater than any other god.
135.6: He does as he chooses in heaven and on earth and deep in the sea.
135.7: The LORD makes the clouds rise from far across the earth, and he makes lightning to go with the rain. Then from his secret place he sends out the wind.
135.8: The LORD killed the first-born of people and animals in the land of Egypt.
135.9: God used miracles and wonders to fight the king of Egypt and all of his officials.
135.10: He destroyed many nations and killed powerful kings,
135.11: including King Sihon of the Amorites and King Og of Bashan. He conquered every kingdom in the land of Canaan
135.12: and gave their property to his people Israel.
135.13: The name of the LORD will be remembered forever, and he will be famous for all time to come.
135.14: The LORD will bring justice and show mercy to all who serve him.
135.15: Idols of silver and gold are made and worshiped in other nations.
135.16: They have a mouth and eyes, but they can't speak or see.
135.17: They are completely deaf, and they can't breathe.
135.18: Everyone who makes idols and all who trust them will end up as helpless as their idols.
135.19: Everyone in Israel, come praise the LORD! All the family of Aaron
135.20: and all the tribe of Levi, come praise the LORD! All of his worshipers, come praise the LORD.
135.21: Praise the LORD from Zion! He lives here in Jerusalem. Shout praises to the LORD!

136.1: Praise the LORD! He is good. God's love never fails.
136.2: Praise the God of all gods. God's love never fails.
136.3: Praise the Lord of lords. God's love never fails.
136.4: Only God works great miracles. God's love never fails.
136.5: With wisdom he made the sky. God's love never fails.
136.6: The Lord stretched the earth over the ocean. God's love never fails.
136.7: He made the bright lights in the sky. God's love never fails.
136.8: He lets the sun rule each day. God's love never fails.
136.9: He lets the moon and the stars rule each night. God's love never fails.
136.10: God struck down the first-born in every Egyptian family. God's love never fails.
136.11: He rescued Israel from Egypt. God's love never fails.
136.12: God used his great strength and his powerful arm. God's love never fails.
136.13: He split the Red Sea apart. God's love never fails.
136.14: The Lord brought Israel safely through the sea. God's love never fails.
136.15: He destroyed the Egyptian king and his army there. God's love never fails.
136.16: The Lord led his people through the desert. God's love never fails.
136.17: Our God defeated mighty kings. God's love never fails.
136.18: And he killed famous kings. God's love never fails.
136.19: One of them was Sihon, king of the Amorites. God's love never fails.
136.20: Another was King Og of Bashan. God's love never fails.
136.21: God took away their land. God's love never fails.
136.22: He gave their land to Israel, the people who serve him. God's love never fails.
136.23: God saw the trouble we were in. God's love never fails.
136.24: He rescued us from our enemies. God's love never fails.
136.25: He gives food to all who live. God's love never fails.
136.26: Praise God in heaven! God's love never fails.

137.1: Beside the rivers of Babylon we thought about Jerusalem, and we sat down and cried.
137.2: We hung our small harps on the willow trees.
137.3: Our enemies had brought us here as their prisoners; now they wanted us to sing and entertain them. They insulted us and shouted, "Sing about Zion!"
137.4: Here in a foreign land, how can we sing about the LORD?
137.5: Jerusalem, if I forget you, let my right hand go limp.
137.6: Let my tongue stick to the roof of my mouth, if I don't think about you above all else.
137.7: Our LORD, punish the Edomites! On the day Jerusalem fell, they shouted, "Completely destroy the city! Tear down every building!"
137.8: Babylon, you are doomed! I pray the Lord's blessings on anyone who punishes you for what you did to us.
137.9: May the Lord bless everyone who beats your children against the rocks!

138.1: With all my heart I praise you, LORD. In the presence of angels I sing your praises.
138.2: I worship at your holy temple and praise you for your love and your faithfulness. You were true to your word and made yourself more famous than ever before.
138.3: When I asked for your help, you answered my prayer and gave me courage.
138.4: All kings on this earth have heard your promises, LORD, and they will praise you.
138.5: You are so famous that they will sing about the things you have done.
138.6: Though you are above us all, you care for humble people, and you keep a close watch on everyone who is proud.
138.7: I am surrounded by trouble, but you protect me against my angry enemies. With your own powerful arm you keep me safe.
138.8: You, LORD, will always treat me with kindness. Your love never fails. You have made us what we are. Don't give up on us now!

139.1: You have looked deep into my heart, LORD, and you know all about me.
139.2: You know when I am resting or when I am working, and from heaven you discover my thoughts.
139.3: You notice everything I do and everywhere I go.
139.4: Before I even speak a word, you know what I will say,
139.5: and with your powerful arm you protect me from every side.
139.6: I can't understand all of this! Such wonderful knowledge is far above me.
139.7: Where could I go to escape from your Spirit or from your sight?
139.8: If I were to climb up to the highest heavens, you would be there. If I were to dig down to the world of the dead you would also be there.
139.9: Suppose I had wings like the dawning day and flew across the ocean.
139.10: Even then your powerful arm would guide and protect me.
139.11: Or suppose I said, "I'll hide in the dark until night comes to cover me over."
139.12: But you see in the dark because daylight and dark are all the same to you.
139.13: You are the one who put me together inside my mother's body,
139.14: and I praise you because of the wonderful way you created me. Everything you do is marvelous! Of this I have no doubt.
139.15: Nothing about me is hidden from you! I was secretly woven together out of human sight,
139.16: but with your own eyes you saw my body being formed. Even before I was born, you had written in your book everything about me.
139.17: Your thoughts are far beyond my understanding, much more than I could ever imagine.
139.18: I try to count your thoughts, but they outnumber the grains of sand on the beach. And when I awake, I will find you nearby.
139.19: How I wish that you would kill all cruel and heartless people and protect me from them!
139.20: They are always rebelling and speaking evil of you.
139.21: You know I hate anyone who hates you, LORD, and refuses to obey.
139.22: They are my enemies too, and I truly hate them.
139.23: Look deep into my heart, God, and find out everything I am thinking.
139.24: Don't let me follow evil ways, but lead me in the way that time has proven true.

140.1: Rescue me from cruel and violent enemies, LORD!
140.2: They think up evil plans and always cause trouble.
140.3: Their words bite deep like the poisonous fangs of a snake.
140.4: Protect me, LORD, from cruel and brutal enemies, who want to destroy me.
140.5: Those proud people have hidden traps and nets to catch me as I walk.
140.6: You, LORD, are my God! Please listen to my prayer.
140.7: You have the power to save me, and you keep me safe in every battle.
140.8: Don't let the wicked succeed in doing what they want, or else they might never stop planning evil.
140.9: They have me surrounded, but make them the victims of their own vicious lies.
140.10: Dump flaming coals on them and throw them into pits where they can't climb out.
140.11: Chase those cruel liars away! Let trouble hunt them down.
140.12: Our LORD, I know that you defend the homeless and see that the poor are given justice.
140.13: Your people will praise you and will live with you because they do right.

141.1: I pray to you, LORD! Please listen when I pray and hurry to help me.
141.2: Think of my prayer as sweet-smelling incense, and think of my lifted hands as an evening sacrifice.
141.3: Help me to guard my words whenever I say something.
141.4: Don't let me want to do evil or waste my time doing wrong with wicked people. Don't let me even taste the good things they offer.
141.5: Let your faithful people correct and punish me. My prayers condemn the deeds of those who do wrong, so don't let me be friends with any of them.
141.6: Everyone will admit that I was right when their rulers are thrown down a rocky cliff,
141.7: and their bones lie scattered like crushed rocks on top of a grave.
141.8: You are my LORD and God, and I look to you for safety. Don't let me be harmed.
141.9: Protect me from the traps of those violent people,
141.10: and make them fall into their own traps while you help me escape.

142.1: I pray to you, LORD. I beg for mercy.
142.2: I tell you all my worries and my troubles,
142.3: and whenever I feel low, you are there to guide me. A trap has been hidden along my pathway.
142.4: Even if you look, you won't see anyone who cares enough to walk beside me. There is no place to hide, and no one who really cares.
142.5: I pray to you, LORD! You are my place of safety, and you are my choice in the land of the living. Please answer my prayer. I am completely helpless.
142.6: Help! They are chasing me, and they are too strong.
142.7: Rescue me from this prison, so I can praise your name. And when your people notice your wonderful kindness to me, they will rush to my side.

143.1: Listen, LORD, as I pray! You are faithful and honest and will answer my prayer.
143.2: I am your servant. Don't try me in your court, because no one is innocent by your standards.
143.3: My enemies are chasing me, crushing me in the ground. I am in total darkness, like someone long dead.
143.4: I have given up hope, and I feel numb all over.
143.5: I remember to think about the many things you did in years gone by.
143.6: Then I lift my hands in prayer, because my soul is a desert, thirsty for water from you.
143.7: Please hurry, LORD, and answer my prayer. I feel hopeless. Don't turn away and leave me here to die.
143.8: Each morning let me learn more about your love because I trust you. I come to you in prayer, asking for your guidance.
143.9: Please rescue me from my enemies, LORD! I come to you for safety.
143.10: You are my God. Show me what you want me to do, and let your gentle Spirit lead me in the right path.
143.11: Be true to your name, LORD, and keep my life safe. Use your saving power to protect me from trouble.
143.12: I am your servant. Show how much you love me by destroying my enemies.

144.1: I praise you, LORD! You are my mighty rock, and you teach me how to fight my battles.
144.2: You are my friend, my fortress, where I am safe. You are my shield, and you made me the ruler of our people.
144.3: Why do we humans mean anything to you, our LORD? Why do you care about us?
144.4: We disappear like a breath; we last no longer than a faint shadow.
144.5: Open the heavens like a curtain and come down, LORD. Touch the mountains and make them send up smoke.
144.6: Use your lightning as arrows to scatter my enemies and make them run away.
144.7: Reach down from heaven and set me free. Save me from the mighty flood
144.8: of those lying foreigners who never tell the truth.
144.9: In praise of you, our God, I will sing a new song, while playing my harp.
144.10: By your power, kings win wars, and your servant David is saved from deadly swords.
144.11: Won't you keep me safe from those lying foreigners who never tell the truth?
144.12: Let's pray that our young sons will grow like strong plants and that our daughters will be as lovely as columns in the corner of a palace.
144.13: May our barns be filled with all kinds of crops. May our fields be covered with sheep by the thousands,
144.14: and every cow have calves. Don't let our city be captured or any of us be taken away, and don't let cries of sorrow be heard in our streets.
144.15: Our LORD and our God, you give these blessings to all who worship you.

145.1: I will praise you, my God and King, and always honor your name.
145.2: I will praise you each day and always honor your name.
145.3: You are wonderful, LORD, and you deserve all praise, because you are much greater than anyone can understand.
145.4: Each generation will announce to the next your wonderful and powerful deeds.
145.5: I will keep thinking about your marvelous glory and your mighty miracles.
145.6: Everyone will talk about your fearsome deeds, and I will tell all nations how great you are.
145.7: They will celebrate and sing about your matchless mercy and your power to save.
145.8: You are merciful, LORD! You are kind and patient and always loving.
145.9: You are good to everyone, and you take care of all your creation.
145.10: All creation will thank you, and your loyal people will praise you.
145.11: They will tell about your marvelous kingdom and your power.
145.12: Then everyone will know about the mighty things you do and your glorious kingdom.
145.13: Your kingdom will never end, and you will rule forever. Our LORD, you keep your word and do everything you say.
145.14: When someone stumbles or falls, you give a helping hand.
145.15: Everyone depends on you, and when the time is right, you provide them with food.
145.16: By your own hand you satisfy the desires of all who live.
145.17: Our LORD, everything you do is kind and thoughtful,
145.18: and you are near to everyone whose prayers are sincere.
145.19: You satisfy the desires of all your worshipers, and you come to save them when they ask for help.
145.20: You take care of everyone who loves you, but you destroy the wicked.
145.21: I will praise you, LORD, and everyone will respect your holy name forever.

146.1: Shout praises to the LORD! With all that I am, I will shout his praises.
146.2: I will sing and praise the LORD God as long as I live.
146.3: You can't depend on anyone, not even a great leader.
146.4: Once they die and are buried, that will be the end of all their plans.
146.5: The LORD God of Jacob blesses everyone who trusts him and depends on him.
146.6: God made heaven and earth; he created the sea and everything else. God always keeps his word.
146.7: He gives justice to the poor and food to the hungry. The LORD sets prisoners free
146.8: and heals blind eyes. He gives a helping hand to everyone who falls. The LORD loves good people
146.9: and looks after strangers. He defends the rights of orphans and widows, but destroys the wicked.
146.10: The LORD God of Zion will rule forever! Shout praises to the LORD!

147.1: Shout praises to the LORD! Our God is kind, and it is right and good to sing praises to him.
147.2: The LORD rebuilds Jerusalem and brings the people of Israel back home again.
147.3: He renews our hopes and heals our bodies.
147.4: He decided how many stars there would be in the sky and gave each one a name.
147.5: Our LORD is great and powerful! He understands everything.
147.6: The LORD helps the oppressed, but he smears the wicked in the dirt.
147.7: Celebrate and sing! Play your harps for the LORD our God.
147.8: He fills the sky with clouds and sends rain to the earth, so that the hills will be green with grass.
147.9: He provides food for cattle and for the young ravens, when they cry out.
147.10: The LORD doesn't care about the strength of horses or powerful armies.
147.11: The LORD is pleased only with those who worship him and trust his love.
147.12: Everyone in Jerusalem, come and praise the LORD your God!
147.13: He makes your city gates strong and blesses your people.
147.14: God lets you live in peace, and he gives you the very best wheat.
147.15: As soon as God speaks, the earth obeys.
147.16: He covers the ground with snow like a blanket of wool, and he scatters frost like ashes on the ground.
147.17: God sends down hailstones like chips of rocks. Who can stand the cold?
147.18: At his command the ice melts, the wind blows, and streams begin to flow.
147.19: God gave his laws and teachings to the descendants of Jacob, the nation of Israel.
147.20: But he has not given his laws to any other nation. Shout praises to the LORD!

148.1: Shout praises to the LORD! Shout the LORD's praises in the highest heavens.
148.2: All of you angels, and all who serve him above, come and offer praise.
148.3: Sun and moon, and all of you bright stars, come and offer praise.
148.4: Highest heavens, and the water above the highest heavens, come and offer praise.
148.5: Let all things praise the name of the LORD, because they were created at his command.
148.6: He made them to last forever, and nothing can change what he has done.
148.7: All creatures on earth, you obey his commands, so come praise the LORD!
148.8: Sea monsters and the deep sea, fire and hail, snow and frost, and every stormy wind, come praise the LORD!
148.9: All mountains and hills, fruit trees and cedars,
148.10: every wild and tame animal, all reptiles and birds, come praise the LORD!
148.11: Every king and every ruler, all nations on earth,
148.12: every man and every woman, young people and old, come praise the LORD!
148.13: All creation, come praise the name of the LORD. Praise his name alone. The glory of God is greater than heaven and earth.
148.14: Like a bull with mighty horns, the LORD protects his faithful nation Israel, because they belong to him. Shout praises to the LORD!

149.1: Shout praises to the LORD! Sing him a new song of praise when his loyal people meet.
149.2: People of Israel, rejoice because of your Creator. People of Zion, celebrate because of your King.
149.3: Praise his name by dancing and playing music on harps and tambourines.
149.4: The LORD is pleased with his people, and he gives victory to those who are humble.
149.5: All of you faithful people, praise our glorious Lord! Celebrate and worship.
149.6: Praise God with songs on your lips and a sword in your hand.
149.7: Take revenge and punish the nations.
149.8: Put chains of iron on their kings and rulers.
149.9: Punish them as they deserve; this is the privilege of God's faithful people. Shout praises to the LORD!

150.1: Shout praises to the LORD! Praise God in his temple. Praise him in heaven, his mighty fortress.
150.2: Praise our God! His deeds are wonderful, too marvelous to describe.
150.3: Praise God with trumpets and all kinds of harps.
150.4: Praise him with tambourines and dancing, with stringed instruments and woodwinds.
150.5: Praise God with cymbals, with clashing cymbals.
150.6: Let every living creature praise the LORD. Shout praises to the LORD!

1.1: These are the proverbs of King Solomon of Israel, the son of David.
1.2: Proverbs will teach you wisdom and self-control and how to understand sayings with deep meanings.
1.3: You will learn what is right and honest and fair.
1.4: From these, an ordinary person can learn to be smart, and young people can gain knowledge and good sense.
1.5: If you are already wise, you will become even wiser. And if you are smart, you will learn to understand
1.6: proverbs and sayings, as well as words of wisdom, and all kinds of riddles.
1.7: Respect and obey the LORD! This is the beginning of knowledge. Only a fool rejects wisdom and good advice.
1.8: My child, obey the teachings of your parents,
1.9: and wear their teachings as you would a pretty hat or a lovely necklace.
1.10: Don't be tempted by sinners or listen
1.12: They're well and healthy now, but we'll finish them off once and for all.
1.13: We'll take their valuables and fill our homes with stolen goods.
1.14: If you join our gang, you'll get your share."
1.15: Don't follow anyone like that or do what they do.
1.16: They are in a big hurry to commit some crime, perhaps even murder.
1.17: They are like a bird that sees the bait, but ignores the trap.
1.18: They gang up to murder someone, but they are the victims.
1.19: The wealth you get from crime robs you of your life.
1.20: Wisdom shouts in the streets wherever crowds gather.
1.21: She shouts in the marketplaces and near the city gates as she says to the people,
1.22: "How much longer will you enjoy being stupid fools? Won't you ever stop sneering and laughing at knowledge?
1.23: Listen as I correct you and tell you what I think.
1.24: You completely ignored me and refused to listen;
1.25: you rejected my advice and paid no attention when I warned you.
1.26: "So when you are struck by some terrible disaster,
1.27: or when trouble and distress surround you like a whirlwind, I will laugh and make fun.
1.28: You will ask for my help, but I won't listen; you will search, but you won't find me.
1.29: No, you would not learn, and you refused to respect the LORD.
1.30: You rejected my advice and paid no attention when I warned you.
1.31: "Now you will eat the fruit of what you have done, until you are stuffed full with your own schemes.
1.32: Sin and self-satisfaction bring destruction and death to stupid fools.
1.33: But if you listen to me, you will be safe and secure without fear of disaster."

2.1: My child, you must follow and treasure my teachings and my instructions.
2.2: Keep in tune with wisdom and think what it means to have common sense.
2.3: Beg as loud as you can for good common sense.
2.4: Search for wisdom as you would search for silver or hidden treasure.
2.5: Then you will understand what it means to respect and to know the LORD God.
2.6: All wisdom comes from the LORD, and so do common sense and understanding.
2.7: God gives helpful advice to everyone who obeys him and protects those who live as they should.
2.8: God sees that justice is done, and he watches over everyone who is faithful to him.
2.9: With wisdom you will learn what is right and honest and fair.
2.10: Wisdom will control your mind, and you will be pleased with knowledge.
2.11: Sound judgment and good sense will watch over you.
2.12: Wisdom will protect you from evil schemes and from those liars
2.13: who turned from doing good to live in the darkness.
2.14: Most of all they enjoy being mean and deceitful.
2.15: They are dishonest themselves, and so are all their deeds.
2.16: Wisdom will protect you from the smooth talk of a sinful woman,
2.17: who breaks her wedding vows and leaves the man she married when she was young.
2.18: The road to her house leads down to the dark world of the dead.
2.19: Visit her, and you will never find the road to life again.
2.20: Follow the example of good people and live an honest life.
2.21: If you are honest and innocent, you will keep your land;
2.22: if you do wrong and can never be trusted, you will be rooted out.

3.1: My child, remember my teachings and instructions and obey them completely.
3.2: They will help you live a long and prosperous life.
3.3: Let love and loyalty always show like a necklace, and write them in your mind.
3.4: God and people will like you and hold you in high esteem.
3.5: With all your heart you must trust the LORD and not your own judgment.
3.6: Always let him lead you, and he will clear the road for you to follow.
3.7: Don't ever think that you are wise enough, but respect the LORD and stay away from evil.
3.8: This will make you healthy, and you will feel strong.
3.9: Honor the LORD by giving him your money and the first part of all your crops.
3.10: Then you will have more grain and grapes than you will ever need.
3.11: My child, don't turn away or become bitter when the LORD corrects you.
3.12: The LORD corrects everyone he loves, just as parents correct a child they dearly love.
3.13: God blesses everyone who has wisdom and common sense.
3.14: Wisdom is worth more than silver; it makes you much richer than gold.
3.15: Wisdom is more valuable than precious jewels; nothing you want compares with her.
3.16: In her right hand Wisdom holds a long life, and in her left hand are wealth and honor.
3.17: Wisdom makes life pleasant and leads us safely along.
3.18: Wisdom is a life-giving tree, the source of happiness for all who hold on to her.
3.19: By his wisdom and knowledge the LORD created heaven and earth.
3.20: By his understanding he let the ocean break loose and clouds release the rain.
3.21: My child, use common sense and sound judgment! Always keep them in mind.
3.22: They will help you to live a long and beautiful life.
3.23: You will walk safely and never stumble;
3.24: you will rest without a worry and sleep soundly.
3.25: So don't be afraid of sudden disasters or storms that strike those who are evil.
3.26: You can be sure that the LORD will protect you from harm.
3.27: Do all you can for everyone who deserves your help.
3.28: Don't tell your neighbor to come back tomorrow, if you can help today.
3.29: Don't try to be mean to neighbors who trust you.
3.30: Don't argue just to be arguing, when you haven't been hurt.
3.31: Don't be jealous of cruel people or follow their example.
3.32: The LORD doesn't like anyone who is dishonest, but he lets good people be his friends.
3.33: He places a curse on the home of everyone who is evil, but he blesses the home of every good person.
3.34: The LORD sneers at those who sneer at him, but he is kind to everyone who is humble.
3.35: You will be praised if you are wise, but you will be disgraced if you are a stubborn fool.

4.1: My child, listen closely to my teachings and learn common sense.
4.2: My advice is useful, so don't turn away.
4.3: When I was still very young and my mother's favorite child, my father
4.4: said to me: "If you follow my teachings and keep them in mind, you will live.
4.5: Be wise and learn good sense; remember my teachings and do what I say.
4.6: "If you love Wisdom and don't reject her, she will watch over you.
4.7: The best thing about Wisdom is Wisdom herself; good sense is more important than anything else.
4.8: If you value Wisdom and hold tightly to her, great honors will be yours.
4.9: It will be like wearing a glorious crown of beautiful flowers."
4.10: My child, if you listen and obey my teachings, you will live a long time.
4.11: I have shown you the way that makes sense; I have guided you along the right path.
4.12: Your road won't be blocked, and you won't stumble when you run.
4.13: Hold firmly to my teaching and never let go. It will mean life for you.
4.14: Don't follow the bad example of cruel and evil people.
4.15: Turn aside and keep going. Stay away from them.
4.16: They can't sleep or rest until they do wrong or harm some innocent victim.
4.17: Their food and drink are cruelty and wickedness.
4.18: The lifestyle of good people is like sunlight at dawn that keeps getting brighter until broad daylight.
4.19: The lifestyle of the wicked is like total darkness, and they will never know what makes them stumble.
4.20: My child, listen carefully to everything I say.
4.21: Don't forget a single word, but think about it all.
4.22: Knowing these teachings will mean true life and good health for you.
4.23: Carefully guard your thoughts because they are the source of true life.
4.24: Never tell lies or be deceitful in what you say.
4.25: Keep looking straight ahead, without turning aside.
4.26: Know where you are headed, and you will stay on solid ground.
4.27: Don't make a mistake by turning to the right or the left.

5.1: My son, if you listen closely to my wisdom and good sense,
5.2: you will have sound judgment, and you will always know the right thing to say.
5.3: The words of an immoral woman may be as sweet as honey and as smooth as olive oil.
5.4: But all that you really get from being with her is bitter poison and pain.
5.5: If you follow her, she will lead you down to the world of the dead.
5.6: She has missed the path that leads to life and doesn't even know it.
5.7: My son, listen to me and do everything I say.
5.8: Stay away from a bad woman! Don't even go near the door of her house.
5.9: You will lose your self-respect and end up in debt to some cruel person for the rest of your life.
5.10: Strangers will get your money and everything else you have worked for.
5.11: When it's all over, your body will waste away, as you groan
5.12: and shout, "I hated advice and correction!
5.13: I paid no attention to my teachers,
5.14: and now I am disgraced in front of everyone."
5.15: You should be faithful to your wife, just as you take water from your own well.
5.16: And don't be like a stream from which just any woman may take a drink.
5.17: Save yourself for your wife and don't have sex with other women.
5.18: Be happy with the wife you married when you were young.
5.19: She is beautiful and graceful, just like a deer; you should be attracted to her and stay deeply in love.
5.20: Don't go crazy over a woman who is unfaithful to her own husband!
5.21: The LORD sees everything, and he watches us closely.
5.22: Sinners are trapped and caught by their own evil deeds.
5.23: They get lost and die because of their foolishness and lack of self-control.

6.1: My child, suppose you agree to pay the debt of someone, who cannot repay a loan.
6.2: Then you are trapped by your own words,
6.3: and you are now in the power of someone else. Here is what you should do: Go and beg for permission to call off the agreement.
6.4: Do this before you fall asleep or even get sleepy.
6.5: Save yourself, just as a deer or a bird tries to escape from a hunter.
6.6: You lazy people can learn by watching an anthill.
6.7: Ants don't have leaders,
6.8: but they store up food during harvest season.
6.9: How long will you lie there doing nothing at all? When are you going to get up and stop sleeping?
6.10: Sleep a little. Doze a little. Fold your hands and twiddle your thumbs.
6.11: Suddenly, everything is gone, as though it had been taken by an armed robber.
6.12: Worthless liars go around
6.13: winking and giving signals to deceive others.
6.14: They are always thinking up something cruel and evil, and they stir up trouble.
6.15: But they will be struck by sudden disaster and left without a hope.
6.16: There are six or seven kinds of people the LORD doesn't like:
6.17: Those who are too proud or tell lies or murder,
6.18: those who make evil plans or are quick to do wrong,
6.19: those who tell lies in court or stir up trouble in a family.
6.20: Obey the teaching of your parents--
6.21: always keep it in mind and never forget it.
6.22: Their teaching will guide you when you walk, protect you when you sleep, and talk to you when you are awake.
6.23: The Law of the Lord is a lamp, and its teachings shine brightly. Correction and self-control will lead you through life.
6.24: They will protect you from the flattering words of someone else's wife.
6.25: Don't let yourself be attracted by the charm and lovely eyes of someone like that.
6.26: A woman who sells her love can be bought for as little as the price of a meal. But making love to another man's wife will cost you everything.
6.27: If you carry burning coals, you burn your clothes;
6.28: if you step on hot coals, you burn your feet.
6.29: And if you go to bed with another man's wife, you pay the price.
6.30: We don't put up with thieves, not even with one who steals for something to eat.
6.31: And thieves who get caught must pay back seven times what was stolen and lose everything.
6.32: But if you go to bed with another man's wife, you will destroy yourself by your own stupidity.
6.33: You will be beaten and forever disgraced,
6.34: because a jealous husband can be furious and merciless when he takes revenge.
6.35: He won't let you pay him off, no matter what you offer.

7.1: My son, pay close attention and don't forget what I tell you to do.
7.2: Obey me, and you will live! Let my instructions be your greatest treasure.
7.3: Keep them at your fingertips and write them in your mind.
7.4: Let wisdom be your sister and make common sense your closest friend.
7.5: They will protect you from the flattering words of someone else's wife.
7.6: From the window of my house, I once happened to see
7.7: some foolish young men.
7.8: It was late in the evening, sometime after dark.
7.9: One of these young men turned the corner and was walking by the house of an unfaithful wife.
7.10: She was dressed fancy like a woman of the street with only one thing in mind.
7.11: She was one of those women who are loud and restless and never stay at home,
7.12: who walk street after street, waiting to trap a man.
7.13: She grabbed him and kissed him, and with no sense of shame, she said:
7.14: "I had to offer a sacrifice, and there is enough meat left over for a feast.
7.15: So I came looking for you, and here you are!
7.16: The sheets on my bed are bright-colored cloth from Egypt.
7.17: And I have covered it with perfume made of myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.
7.18: "Let's go there and make love all night.
7.19: My husband is traveling, and he's far away.
7.20: He took a lot of money along, and he won't be back home before the middle of the month."
7.21: And so, she tricked him with all of her sweet talk and her flattery.
7.22: At once he followed her like an ox on the way to be slaughtered, or like a fool on the way to be punished
7.23: and killed with arrows. He was no more than a bird rushing into a trap, without knowing it would cost him his life.
7.24: My son, pay close attention to what I have said.
7.25: Don't even think about that kind of woman or let yourself be misled by someone like her.
7.26: Such a woman has caused the downfall and destruction of a lot of men.
7.27: Her house is a one-way street leading straight down to the world of the dead.

8.1: With great understanding, Wisdom is calling out
8.2: as she stands at the crossroads and on every hill.
8.3: She stands by the city gate where everyone enters the city, and she shouts:
8.4: "I am calling out to each one of you!
8.5: Good sense and sound judgment can be yours.
8.6: Listen, because what I say is worthwhile and right.
8.7: I always speak the truth and refuse to tell a lie.
8.8: Every word I speak is honest, not one is misleading or deceptive.
8.9: "If you have understanding, you will see that my words are just what you need.
8.10: Let instruction and knowledge mean more to you than silver or the finest gold.
8.11: Wisdom is worth much more than precious jewels or anything else you desire."
8.12: I am Wisdom--Common Sense is my closest friend; I possess knowledge and sound judgment.
8.13: If you respect the LORD, you will hate evil. I hate pride and conceit and deceitful lies.
8.14: I am strong, and I offer sensible advice and sound judgment.
8.15: By my power kings govern, and rulers make laws that are fair.
8.16: Every honest leader rules with help from me.
8.17: I love everyone who loves me, and I will be found by all who honestly search.
8.18: I can make you rich and famous, important and successful.
8.19: What you receive from me is more valuable than even the finest gold or the purest silver.
8.20: I always do what is right,
8.21: and I give great riches to everyone who loves me.
8.22: From the beginning, I was with the LORD. I was there before he began
8.23: to create the earth. At the very first, the LORD gave life to me.
8.24: When I was born, there were no oceans or springs of water.
8.25: My birth was before mountains were formed or hills were put in place.
8.26: It happened long before God had made the earth or any of its fields or even the dust.
8.27: I was there when the LORD put the heavens in place and stretched the sky over the surface of the sea.
8.28: I was with him when he placed the clouds in the sky and created the springs that fill the ocean.
8.29: I was there when he set boundaries for the sea to make it obey him, and when he laid foundations to support the earth.
8.30: I was right beside the LORD, helping him plan and build. I made him happy each day, and I was happy at his side.
8.31: I was pleased with his world and pleased with its people.
8.32: Pay attention, my children! Follow my advice, and you will be happy.
8.33: Listen carefully to my instructions, and you will be wise.
8.34: Come to my home each day and listen to me. You will find happiness.
8.35: By finding me, you find life, and the LORD will be pleased with you.
8.36: But if you don't find me, you hurt only yourself, and if you hate me, you are in love with death.

9.1: Wisdom has built her house with its seven columns.
9.2: She has prepared the meat and set out the wine. Her feast is ready.
9.3: She has sent her servant women to announce her invitation from the highest hills:
9.4: "Everyone who is ignorant or foolish is invited!
9.6: If you want to live, give up your foolishness and let understanding guide your steps."
9.7: Correct a worthless bragger, and all you will get are insults and injuries.
9.8: Any bragger you correct will only hate you. But if you correct someone who has common sense, you will be loved.
9.9: If you have good sense, instruction will help you to have even better sense. And if you live right, education will help you to know even more.
9.10: Respect and obey the LORD! This is the beginning of wisdom. To have understanding, you must know the Holy God.
9.11: I am Wisdom. If you follow me, you will live a long time.
9.12: Good sense is good for you, but if you brag, you hurt yourself.
9.13: Stupidity is reckless, senseless, and foolish.
9.14: She sits in front of her house and on the highest hills in the town.
9.15: She shouts to everyone who passes by,
9.16: "If you are stupid, come on inside!" And to every fool she says,
9.17: "Stolen water tastes best, and the food you eat in secret tastes best of all."
9.18: None who listen to Stupidity understand that her guests are as good as dead.

10.1: Here are some proverbs of Solomon: Children with good sense make their parents happy, but foolish children make them sad.
10.2: What you gain by doing evil won't help you at all. Obeying God is the only way to be saved from death.
10.3: If you obey the LORD, you won't go hungry; if you are wicked, God won't let you have what you want.
10.4: Laziness leads to poverty; hard work makes you rich.
10.5: At harvest season it's smart to work hard, but stupid to sleep.
10.6: Everyone praises good people, but evil hides behind the words of the wicked.
10.7: Good people are remembered long after they are gone, but the wicked are soon forgotten.
10.8: If you have good sense, you will listen and obey; if all you do is talk foolishly, you will destroy yourself.
10.9: You will be safe, if you always do right, but you will get caught, if you are dishonest.
10.10: Deceit causes trouble, and foolish talk will bring you to ruin.
10.11: The words of good people are a source of life, but evil hides behind the words of the wicked.
10.12: Hatred stirs up trouble; love overlooks the wrongs that others do.
10.13: If you have good sense, it will show when you speak. But if you are stupid, you will be beaten with a stick.
10.14: If you have good sense, you will learn all you can, but foolish talk will soon destroy you.
10.15: Great wealth can be a fortress, but poverty is no protection at all.
10.16: If you live right, the reward is a good life; if you are evil, all you have is sin.
10.17: Accept correction, and you will find life; reject correction, and you will miss the road.
10.18: You can hide your hatred by telling lies, but you are a fool to spread lies.
10.19: You will say the wrong thing if you talk too much--so be sensible and watch what you say.
10.20: The words of a good person are like pure silver, but the thoughts of an evil person are almost worthless.
10.21: Many are helped by useful instruction, but fools are killed by their own stupidity.
10.22: When the LORD blesses you with riches, you have nothing to regret.
10.23: Fools enjoy doing wrong, but anyone with good sense enjoys acting wisely.
10.24: What evil people dread most will happen to them, but good people will get what they want most.
10.25: Those crooks will disappear when a storm strikes, but God will keep safe all who obey him.
10.26: Having a lazy person on the job is like a mouth full of vinegar or smoke in your eyes.
10.27: If you respect the LORD, you will live longer; if you keep doing wrong, your life will be cut short.
10.28: If you obey the Lord, you will be happy, but there is no future for the wicked.
10.29: The LORD protects everyone who lives right, but he destroys anyone who does wrong.
10.30: Good people will stand firm, but the wicked will disappear from the land.
10.31: Honest people speak sensibly, but deceitful liars will be silenced.
10.32: If you obey the Lord, you will always know the right thing to say. But no one will trust you if you tell lies.

11.1: The LORD hates anyone who cheats, but he likes everyone who is honest.
11.2: Too much pride can put you to shame. It's wiser to be humble.
11.3: If you do the right thing, honesty will be your guide. But if you are crooked, you will be trapped by your own dishonesty.
11.4: When God is angry, money won't help you. Obeying God is the only way to be saved from death.
11.5: If you are truly good, you will do right; if you are wicked, you will be destroyed by your own sin.
11.6: Honesty can keep you safe, but if you can't be trusted, you trap yourself.
11.7: When the wicked die, their hopes die with them.
11.8: Trouble goes right past the LORD's people and strikes the wicked.
11.9: Dishonest people use gossip to destroy their neighbors; good people are protected by their own good sense.
11.10: When honest people prosper and the wicked disappear, the whole city celebrates.
11.11: Good people bring prosperity to their city, but deceitful liars can destroy a city.
11.12: It's stupid to say bad things about your neighbors. If you are sensible, you will keep quiet.
11.13: A gossip tells everything, but a true friend will keep a secret.
11.14: A city without wise leaders will end up in ruin; a city with many wise leaders will be kept safe.
11.15: It's a dangerous thing to guarantee payment for someone's debts. Don't do it!
11.16: A gracious woman will be respected, but a ruthless man will only get rich.
11.17: Kindness is rewarded--but if you are cruel, you hurt yourself.
11.18: Meanness gets you nowhere, but goodness is rewarded.
11.19: Always do the right thing, and you will live; keep on doing wrong, and you will die.
11.20: The LORD hates sneaky people, but he likes everyone who lives right.
11.21: You can be sure of this: All crooks will be punished, but God's people won't.
11.22: A beautiful woman who acts foolishly is like a gold ring on the snout of a pig.
11.23: Good people want what is best, but troublemakers hope to stir up trouble.
11.24: Sometimes you can become rich by being generous or poor by being greedy.
11.25: Generosity will be rewarded: Give a cup of water, and you will receive a cup of water in return.
11.26: Charge too much for grain, and you will be cursed; sell it at a fair price, and you will be praised.
11.27: Try hard to do right, and you will win friends; go looking for trouble, and you will find it.
11.28: Trust in your wealth, and you will be a failure, but God's people will prosper like healthy plants.
11.29: Fools who cause trouble in the family won't inherit a thing. They will end up as slaves of someone with good sense.
11.30: Live right, and you will eat from the life-giving tree. And if you act wisely, others will follow.
11.31: If good people are rewarded here on this earth, all who are cruel and mean will surely be punished.

12.1: To accept correction is wise, to reject it is stupid.
12.2: The LORD likes everyone who lives right, but he punishes everyone who makes evil plans.
12.3: Sin cannot offer security! But if you live right, you will be as secure as a tree with deep roots.
12.4: A helpful wife is a jewel for her husband, but a shameless wife will make his bones rot.
12.5: Good people have kind thoughts, but you should never trust the advice of someone evil.
12.6: Bad advice is a deadly trap, but good advice is like a shield.
12.7: Once the wicked are defeated, they are gone forever, but no one who obeys God will ever be thrown down.
12.8: Good sense is worthy of praise, but stupidity is a curse.
12.9: It's better to be ordinary and have only one servant than to think you are somebody and starve to death.
12.10: Good people are kind to their animals, but a mean person is cruel.
12.11: Hard working farmers have more than enough food; daydreamers are nothing more than stupid fools.
12.12: An evil person tries to hide behind evil; good people are like trees with deep roots.
12.13: We trap ourselves by telling lies, but we stay out of trouble by living right.
12.14: We are rewarded or punished for what we say and do.
12.15: Fools think they know what is best, but a sensible person listens to advice.
12.16: Losing your temper is foolish; ignoring an insult is smart.
12.17: An honest person tells the truth in court, but a dishonest person tells nothing but lies.
12.18: Sharp words cut like a sword, but words of wisdom heal.
12.19: Truth will last forever; lies are soon found out.
12.20: An evil mind is deceitful, but gentle thoughts bring happiness.
12.21: Good people never have trouble, but troublemakers have more than enough.
12.22: The LORD hates every liar, but he is the friend of all who can be trusted.
12.23: Be sensible and don't tell everything you know--only fools spread foolishness everywhere.
12.24: Work hard, and you will be a leader; be lazy, and you will end up a slave.
12.25: Worry is a heavy burden, but a kind word always brings cheer.
12.26: You are better off to do right, than to lose your way by doing wrong.
12.27: Anyone too lazy to cook will starve, but a hard worker is a valuable treasure.
12.28: Living right is a pathway that leads to life and away from death.

13.1: Children with good sense accept correction from their parents, but stubborn children ignore it completely.
13.2: You will be well rewarded for saying something kind, but all some people think about is how to be cruel and mean.
13.3: Keep what you know to yourself, and you will be safe; talk too much, and you are done for.
13.4: No matter how much you want, laziness won't help a bit, but hard work will reward you with more than enough.
13.5: A good person hates deceit, but those who are evil cause shame and disgrace.
13.6: Live right, and you are safe! But sin will destroy you.
13.7: Some who have nothing may pretend to be rich, and some who have everything may pretend to be poor.
13.8: The rich may have to pay a ransom, but the poor don't have that problem.
13.9: The lamp of a good person keeps on shining; the lamp of an evil person soon goes out.
13.10: Too much pride causes trouble. Be sensible and take advice.
13.11: Money wrongly gained will disappear bit by bit; money earned little by little will grow and grow.
13.12: Not getting what you want can break your heart, but a wish that comes true is a life-giving tree.
13.13: If you reject God's teaching, you will pay the price; if you obey his commands, you will be rewarded.
13.14: Sensible instruction is a life-giving fountain that helps you escape all deadly traps.
13.15: Sound judgment is praised, but people without good sense are on the way to disaster.
13.16: If you have good sense, you will act sensibly, but fools act like fools.
13.17: Whoever delivers your message can make things better or worse for you.
13.18: All who refuse correction will be poor and disgraced; all who accept correction will be praised.
13.19: It's a good feeling to get what you want, but only a stupid fool hates to turn from evil.
13.20: Wise friends make you wise, but you hurt yourself by going around with fools.
13.21: You are in for trouble if you sin, but you will be rewarded if you live right.
13.22: If you obey God, you will have something to leave your grandchildren. If you don't obey God, those who live right will get what you leave.
13.23: Even when the land of the poor produces good crops, they get cheated out of what they grow.
13.24: If you love your children, you will correct them; if you don't love them, you won't correct them.
13.25: If you live right, you will have plenty to eat; if you don't live right, you will go away empty.

14.1: A woman's family is held together by her wisdom, but it can be destroyed by her foolishness.
14.2: By living right, you show that you respect the LORD; by being deceitful, you show that you despise him.
14.3: Proud fools are punished for their stupid talk, but sensible talk can save your life.
14.4: Without the help of an ox there can be no crop, but with a strong ox a big crop is possible.
14.5: An honest witness tells the truth; a dishonest witness tells nothing but lies.
14.6: Make fun of wisdom, and you will never find it. But if you have understanding, knowledge comes easily.
14.7: Stay away from fools, or you won't learn a thing.
14.8: Wise people have enough sense to find their way, but stupid fools get lost.
14.9: Fools don't care if they are wrong, but God is pleased when people do right.
14.10: No one else can really know how sad or happy you are.
14.11: The tent of a good person stands longer than the house of someone evil.
14.12: You may think you are on the right road and still end up dead.
14.13: Sorrow may hide behind laughter, and happiness may end in sorrow.
14.14: You harvest what you plant, whether good or bad.
14.15: Don't be stupid and believe all you hear; be smart and know where you are headed.
14.16: Only a stupid fool is never cautious--so be extra careful and stay out of trouble.
14.17: Fools have quick tempers, and no one likes you if you can't be trusted.
14.18: Stupidity leads to foolishness; be smart and learn.
14.19: The wicked will come crawling to those who obey God.
14.20: You have no friends if you are poor, but you have lots of friends if you are rich.
14.21: It's wrong to hate others, but God blesses everyone who is kind to the poor.
14.22: It's a mistake to make evil plans, but you will have loyal friends if you want to do right.
14.23: Hard work is worthwhile, but empty talk will make you poor.
14.24: Wisdom can make you rich, but foolishness leads to more foolishness.
14.25: An honest witness can save your life, but liars can't be trusted.
14.26: If you respect the LORD, you and your children have a strong fortress
14.27: and a life-giving fountain that keeps you safe from deadly traps.
14.28: Rulers of powerful nations are held in honor; rulers of weak nations are nothing at all.
14.29: It's smart to be patient, but it's stupid to lose your temper.
14.30: It's healthy to be content, but envy can eat you up.
14.31: If you mistreat the poor, you insult your Creator; if you are kind to them, you show him respect.
14.32: In times of trouble the wicked are destroyed, but even at death the innocent have faith.
14.33: Wisdom is found in the minds of people with good sense, but fools don't know it.
14.34: Doing right brings honor to a nation, but sin brings disgrace.
14.35: Kings reward servants who act wisely, but they punish those who act foolishly.

15.1: A kind answer soothes angry feelings, but harsh words stir them up.
15.2: Words of wisdom come from the wise, but fools speak foolishness.
15.3: The LORD sees everything, whether good or bad.
15.4: Kind words are good medicine, but deceitful words can really hurt.
15.5: Don't be a fool and disobey your parents. Be smart! Accept correction.
15.6: Good people become wealthy, but those who are evil will lose what they have.
15.7: Words of wisdom make good sense; the thoughts of a fool make no sense at all.
15.8: The LORD is disgusted by gifts from the wicked, but it makes him happy when his people pray.
15.9: The LORD is disgusted with all who do wrong, but he loves everyone who does right.
15.10: If you turn from the right way, you will be punished; if you refuse correction, you will die.
15.11: If the LORD can see everything in the world of the dead, he can see in our hearts.
15.12: Those who sneer at others don't like to be corrected, and they won't ask help from someone with sense.
15.13: Happiness makes you smile; sorrow can crush you.
15.14: Anyone with good sense is eager to learn more, but fools are hungry for foolishness.
15.15: The poor have a hard life, but being content is as good as an endless feast.
15.16: It's better to obey the LORD and have only a little, than to be very rich and terribly anxious.
15.17: A simple meal with love is better than a feast where there is hatred.
15.18: Losing your temper causes a lot of trouble, but staying calm settles arguments.
15.19: A lazy person refuses to clear a thorny path, but everyone who does right walks on a smooth road.
15.20: Children with good sense make their parents happy, but foolish children despise them.
15.21: Stupidity brings happiness to senseless fools, but everyone with good sense follows the straight path.
15.22: Without good advice everything goes wrong--it takes careful planning for things to go right.
15.23: Giving the right answer at the right time makes everyone happy.
15.24: All who are wise follow a road that leads upward to life and away from death.
15.25: The LORD destroys the homes of those who are proud, but he protects the property of widows.
15.26: The LORD hates evil thoughts, but kind words please him.
15.27: Being greedy causes trouble for your family, but you protect yourself by refusing bribes.
15.28: Good people think before they answer, but the wicked speak evil without ever thinking.
15.29: The LORD never even hears the prayers of the wicked, but he answers the prayers of all who obey him.
15.30: A friendly smile makes you happy, and good news makes you feel strong.
15.31: Healthy correction is good, and if you accept it, you will be wise.
15.32: You hurt only yourself by rejecting instruction, but it makes good sense to accept it.
15.33: Showing respect to the LORD will make you wise, and being humble will bring honor to you.

16.1: We humans make plans, but the LORD has the final word.
16.2: We may think we know what is right, but the LORD is the judge of our motives.
16.3: Share your plans with the LORD, and you will succeed.
16.4: The LORD has a reason for everything he does, and he lets evil people live only to be punished.
16.5: The LORD doesn't like anyone who is conceited--you can be sure they will be punished.
16.6: If we truly love God, our sins will be forgiven; if we show him respect, we will keep away from sin.
16.7: When we please the LORD, even our enemies make friends with us.
16.8: It's better to be honest and poor than to be dishonest and rich.
16.9: We make our own plans, but the LORD decides where we will go.
16.10: Rulers speak with authority and are never wrong.
16.11: The LORD watches to see if we are fair or if we cheat others.
16.12: Justice makes rulers powerful. They should hate evil
16.13: and like honesty and truth.
16.14: An angry ruler can put you to death. So be wise! Don't make one angry.
16.15: When a ruler is happy and pleased with you, it's like refreshing rain, and you will live.
16.16: It's much better to be wise and sensible than to be rich.
16.17: God's people avoid evil ways, and they protect themselves by watching where they go.
16.18: Too much pride will destroy you.
16.19: You are better off to be humble and poor than to get rich from what you take by force.
16.20: If you know what you're doing, you will prosper. God blesses everyone who trusts him.
16.21: Good judgment proves that you are wise, and if you speak kindly, you can teach others.
16.22: Good sense is a fountain that gives life, but fools are punished by their foolishness.
16.23: You can persuade others if you are wise and speak sensibly.
16.24: Kind words are like honey--they cheer you up and make you feel strong.
16.25: Sometimes what seems right is really a road to death.
16.26: The hungrier you are, the harder you work.
16.27: Worthless people plan trouble. Even their words burn like a flaming fire.
16.28: Gossip is no good! It causes hard feelings and comes between friends.
16.29: Don't trust violent people. They will mislead you to do the wrong thing.
16.30: When someone winks or grins behind your back, trouble is on the way.
16.31: Gray hair is a glorious crown worn by those who have lived right.
16.32: Controlling your temper is better than being a hero who captures a city.
16.33: We make our own decisions, but the LORD alone determines what happens.

17.1: A dry crust of bread eaten in peace and quiet is better than a feast eaten where everyone argues.
17.2: A wise slave will be placed in charge of a no-good child, and that slave will be given the same inheritance that each child receives.
17.3: Silver and gold are tested by flames of fire; our thoughts are tested by the LORD.
17.4: Troublemakers listen to troublemakers, and liars listen to liars.
17.5: By insulting the poor, you insult your Creator. You will be punished if you make fun of someone in trouble.
17.6: Grandparents are proud of their grandchildren, and children should be proud of their parents.
17.7: It sounds strange for a fool to talk sensibly, but it's even worse for a ruler to tell lies.
17.8: A bribe works miracles like a magic charm that brings good luck.
17.9: You will keep your friends if you forgive them, but you will lose your friends if you keep talking about what they did wrong.
17.10: A sensible person accepts correction, but you can't beat sense into a fool.
17.11: Cruel people want to rebel, and so vicious attackers will be sent against them.
17.12: A bear robbed of her cubs is far less dangerous than a stubborn fool.
17.13: You will always have trouble if you are mean to those who are good to you.
17.14: The start of an argument is like a water leak--so stop it before real trouble breaks out.
17.15: The LORD doesn't like those who defend the guilty or condemn the innocent.
17.16: Why should fools have money for an education when they refuse to learn?
17.17: A friend is there to help, in any situation, and relatives are born to share our troubles.
17.18: It's stupid to guarantee someone else's loan.
17.19: The wicked and the proud love trouble and keep begging to be hurt.
17.20: Dishonesty does you no good, and telling lies will get you in trouble.
17.21: It's never pleasant to be the parent of a fool and have nothing but pain.
17.22: If you are cheerful, you feel good; if you are sad, you hurt all over.
17.23: Crooks accept secret bribes to keep justice from being done.
17.24: Anyone with wisdom knows what makes good sense, but fools can never make up their minds.
17.25: Foolish children bring sorrow and pain to their parents.
17.26: It isn't fair to punish the innocent and those who do right.
17.27: It makes a lot of sense to be a person of few words and to stay calm.
17.28: Even fools seem smart when they are quiet.

18.1: It's selfish and stupid to think only of yourself and to sneer at people who have sense.
18.2: Fools have no desire to learn, instead they would rather give their own opinion.
18.3: Wrongdoing leads to shame and disgrace.
18.4: Words of wisdom are a stream that flows from a deep fountain.
18.5: It's wrong to favor the guilty and keep the innocent from getting justice.
18.6: Foolish talk will get you into a lot of trouble.
