4.1: Finally, my dear friends, since you belong to the Lord Jesus, we beg and urge you to live as we taught you. Then you will please God. You are already living that way, but try even harder.
4.2: Remember the instructions we gave you as followers of the Lord Jesus.
4.3: God wants you to be holy, so don't be immoral in matters of sex.
4.4: Respect and honor your wife.
4.5: Don't be a slave of your desires or live like people who don't know God.
4.6: You must not cheat any of the Lord's followers in matters of sex. Remember, we warned you that he punishes everyone who does such things.
4.7: God didn't choose you to be filthy, but to be pure.
4.8: So if you don't obey these rules, you are not really disobeying us. Instead, you are disobeying God, who gives you his Holy Spirit.
4.9: We don't have to write you about the need to love each other. God has taught you to do this,
4.10: and you already have shown your love for all his people in Macedonia. But, my dear friends, we ask you to do even more.
4.11: Try your best to live quietly, to mind your own business, and to work hard, just as we taught you to do.
4.12: Then you will be respected by people who are not followers of the Lord, and you won't have to depend on anyone.
4.13: My friends, we want you to understand how it will be for those followers who have already died. Then you won't grieve over them and be like people who don't have any hope.
4.14: We believe Jesus died and was raised to life. We also believe that when God brings Jesus back again, he will bring with him all who had faith in Jesus before they died.
4.15: Our Lord Jesus told us that when he comes, we won't go up to meet him ahead of his followers who have already died.
4.16: With a loud command and with the shout of the chief angel and a blast of God's trumpet, the Lord will return from heaven. Then those who had faith in Christ before they died will be raised to life.
4.17: Next, all of us who are still alive will be taken up into the clouds together with them to meet the Lord in the sky. From that time on we will all be with the Lord forever.
4.18: Encourage each other with these words.

5.1: I don't need to write you about the time or date when all this will happen.
5.2: You surely know that the Lord's return will be as a thief coming at night.
5.3: People will think they are safe and secure. But destruction will suddenly strike them like the pains of a woman about to give birth. And they won't escape.
5.4: My dear friends, you don't live in darkness, and so that day won't surprise you like a thief.
5.5: You belong to the light and live in the day. We don't live in the night or belong to the dark.
5.6: Others may sleep, but we should stay awake and be alert.
5.7: People sleep during the night, and some even get drunk.
5.8: But we belong to the day. So we must stay sober and let our faith and love be like a suit of armor. Our firm hope that we will be saved is our helmet.
5.9: God doesn't intend to punish us, but wants us to be saved by our Lord Jesus Christ.
5.10: Christ died for us, so we could live with him, whether we are alive or dead when he comes.
5.11: This is why you must encourage and help each other, just as you are already doing.
5.12: My friends, we ask you to be thoughtful of your leaders who work hard and tell you how to live for the Lord.
5.13: Show them great respect and love because of their work. Try to get along with each other.
5.14: My friends, we beg you to warn anyone who isn't living right. Encourage anyone who feels left out, help all who are weak, and be patient with everyone.
5.15: Don't be hateful to people, just because they are hateful to you. Rather, be good to each other and to everyone else.
5.16: Always be joyful
5.17: and never stop praying.
5.18: Whatever happens, keep thanking God because of Jesus Christ. This is what God wants you to do.
5.19: Don't turn away God's Spirit
5.20: or ignore prophecies.
5.21: Put everything to the test. Accept what is good
5.22: and don't have anything to do with evil.
5.23: I pray that God, who gives peace, will make you completely holy. And may your spirit, soul, and body be kept healthy and faultless until our Lord Jesus Christ returns.
5.24: The one who chose you can be trusted, and he will do this.
5.26: Give the Lord's followers a warm greeting.
5.27: In the name of the Lord I beg you to read this letter to all his followers.
5.28: I pray that our Lord Jesus Christ will be kind to you!

1.1: From Paul, Silas, and Timothy. To the church in Thessalonica, the people of God our Father and of the Lord Jesus Christ.
1.2: I pray that God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ will be kind to you and will bless you with peace!
1.3: My dear friends, we always have good reason to thank God for you, because your faith in God and your love for each other keep growing all the time.
1.4: This is why we brag about you to all of God's churches. We tell them how patient you are and how you keep on having faith, even though you are going through a lot of trouble and suffering.
1.5: All this shows that God judges fairly and is making you fit to share in his kingdom for which you are suffering.
1.6: It is only right for God to punish everyone who is causing you trouble,
1.7: but he will give you relief from your troubles. God will do the same for us, when the Lord Jesus comes from heaven with his powerful angels
1.8: and with a flaming fire. Our Lord Jesus will punish anyone who doesn't know God and won't obey his message.
1.9: Their punishment will be eternal destruction, and they will be kept far from the presence of our Lord and his glorious strength.
1.10: This will happen on the day when the Lord returns to be praised and honored by all who have faith in him and belong to him. This includes you, because you believed what we said.
1.11: God chose you, and we keep praying that God will make you worthy of being his people. We pray for God's power to help you do all the good things you hope to do and your faith makes you want to do.
1.12: Then, because of the undeserved grace of God and our Lord Jesus Christ, you will bring honor to the name of our Lord Jesus, and he will bring honor to you.

2.1: When our Lord Jesus returns, we will be gathered up to meet him. So I ask you, my friends,
2.2: not to be easily upset or disturbed by people who claim the Lord has already come. They may say they heard this directly from the Holy Spirit, or from someone else, or even that they read it in one of our letters.
2.3: But don't be fooled! People will rebel against God. Then before the Lord returns, the wicked one who is doomed to be destroyed will appear.
2.4: He will brag and oppose everything holy or sacred. He will even sit in God's temple and claim to be God.
2.5: Don't you remember I told you this while I was still with you?
2.6: You already know what is holding this wicked one back until it is time for him to come.
2.7: His mysterious power is already at work, but someone is holding him back. And the wicked one won't appear until this someone is out of the way.
2.8: Then he will appear, but the Lord Jesus will kill him simply by breathing on him. He will be completely destroyed by the Lord's glorious return.
2.9: When the wicked one appears, Satan will pretend to work all kinds of miracles, wonders, and signs.
2.10: Lost people will be fooled by his evil deeds. They could be saved, but they will refuse to love the truth and accept it.
2.11: So God will make sure they are fooled into believing a lie.
2.12: All of them will be punished, because they would rather do evil than believe the truth.
2.13: My friends, the Lord loves you, and it is only natural for us to thank God for you. God chose you to be the first ones to be saved. His Spirit made you holy, and you put your faith in the truth.
2.14: God used our preaching as his way of inviting you to share in the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ.
2.15: My friends, this is why you must remain faithful and follow closely what we taught you in person and by our letters.
2.16: God our Father loves us. He treats us with undeserved grace and has given us eternal comfort and a wonderful hope. We pray that our Lord Jesus Christ and God our Father
2.17: will encourage you and help you always to do and say the right thing.

3.1: Finally, our friends, please pray for us. This will help the message about the Lord to spread quickly, and others will respect it, just as you do.
3.2: Pray that we may be kept safe from worthless and evil people. After all, not everyone has faith.
3.3: But the Lord can be trusted to make you strong and protect you from harm.
3.4: He has made us sure that you are obeying what we taught you and that you will keep on obeying.
3.5: I pray that the Lord will guide you to be as loving as God and as patient as Christ.
3.6: My dear friends, in the name of the Lord Jesus, I beg you not to have anything to do with any of your people who loaf around and refuse to obey the instructions we gave you.
3.7: You surely know that you should follow our example. We didn't waste our time loafing,
3.8: and we didn't accept food from anyone without paying for it. We didn't want to be a burden to any of you, so night and day we worked as hard as we could.
3.9: We had the right not to work, but we wanted to set an example for you.
3.10: We also gave you this rule: If you don't work, you don't eat.
3.11: Now we learn that some of you just loaf around and won't do any work, except the work of a busybody.
3.12: So, for the sake of our Lord Jesus Christ, we ask and beg these people to settle down and start working for a living.
3.13: Dear friends, you must never become tired of doing right.
3.14: Be on your guard against any followers who refuse to obey what we have written in this letter. Put them to shame by not having anything to do with them.
3.15: Don't consider them your enemies. Instead, speak kindly to them as you would to any other follower.
3.16: I pray that the Lord, who gives peace, will always bless you with peace. May the Lord be with all of you.
3.17: I always sign my letters as I am now doing: PAUL.
3.18: I pray that our Lord Jesus Christ will be kind to all of you.

1.1: From Paul. God our Savior and Christ Jesus commanded me to be an apostle of Christ Jesus, who gives us hope.
1.2: Timothy, because of our faith, you are like a son to me. I pray that God our Father and our Lord Jesus Christ will be kind and merciful to you. May they bless you with peace!
1.3: When I was leaving for Macedonia, I asked you to stay on in Ephesus and warn certain people there to stop spreading their false teachings.
1.4: You needed to warn them to stop wasting their time on senseless stories and endless lists of ancestors. Such things only cause arguments. They don't help anyone to do God's work that can only be done by faith.
1.5: You must teach people to have genuine love, as well as a good conscience and true faith.
1.6: There are some who have given up these for nothing but empty talk.
1.7: They want to be teachers of the Law of Moses. But they don't know what they are talking about, even though they think they do.
1.8: We know the Law is good, if it is used in the right way.
1.9: We also understand it wasn't given to control people who please God, but to control lawbreakers, criminals, godless people, and sinners. It is for wicked and evil people, and for murderers, who would even kill their own parents.
1.10: The Law was written for people who are sexual perverts or who live as homosexuals or are kidnappers or liars or won't tell the truth in court. It is for anything else that opposes the correct teaching
1.11: of the good news the glorious and wonderful God has given me.
1.12: I thank Christ Jesus our Lord, who has given me the strength for my work because he knew he could trust me.
1.13: I used to say terrible and insulting things about him, and I was cruel. But Christ had mercy on me because I didn't know what I was doing, and I had not yet put my faith in him.
1.14: Christ Jesus our Lord treated me with undeserved grace and has greatly blessed my life with faith and love just like his own.
1.15: "Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners." This saying is true, and it can be trusted. I was the worst sinner of all!
1.16: But since I was worse than anyone else, God had mercy on me and let me be an example of the endless patience of Christ Jesus. He did this so that others would put their faith in Christ and have eternal life.
1.17: I pray that honor and glory will always be given to the only God, who lives forever and is the invisible and eternal King! Amen.
1.18: Timothy, my son, the instructions I am giving you are based on what some prophets once said about you. If you follow these instructions, you will fight like a good soldier.
1.19: You will be faithful and have a clear conscience. Some people have made a mess of their faith because they didn't listen to their consciences.
1.20: Two of them are Hymenaeus and Alexander. I have given these men over to the power of Satan, so they will learn not to oppose God.

2.1: First of all, I ask you to pray for everyone. Ask God to help and bless them all, and tell God how thankful you are for each of them.
2.2: Pray for kings and others in power, so we may live quiet and peaceful lives as we worship and honor God.
2.3: This kind of prayer is good, and it pleases God our Savior.
2.4: God wants everyone to be saved and to know the whole truth, which is,
2.5: There is only one God, and Christ Jesus is the only one who can bring us to God. Jesus was truly human, and he gave himself to rescue all of us.
2.6: God showed us this at the right time.
2.7: This is why God chose me to be a preacher and an apostle of the good news. I am telling the truth. I am not lying. God sent me to teach the Gentiles about faith and truth.
2.8: I want everyone everywhere to lift innocent hands toward heaven and pray, without being angry or arguing with each other.
2.9: I would like for women to wear modest and sensible clothes. They should not have fancy hairdos, or wear expensive clothes, or put on jewelry made of gold or pearls.
2.10: Women who claim to love God should do helpful things for others,
2.11: and they should learn by being quiet and paying attention.
2.12: They should be silent and not be allowed to teach or to tell men what to do.
2.13: After all, Adam was created before Eve,
2.14: and the man Adam wasn't the one who was fooled. It was the woman Eve who was completely fooled and sinned.
2.15: But women will be saved by having children, if they stay faithful, loving, holy, and modest.

3.1: It is true that anyone who desires to be a church official wants to be something worthwhile.
3.2: That's why officials must have a good reputation and be faithful in marriage. They must be self-controlled, sensible, well-behaved, friendly to strangers, and able to teach.
3.3: They must not be heavy drinkers or troublemakers. Instead, they must be kind and gentle and not love money.
3.4: Church officials must be in control of their own families, and they must see that their children are obedient and always respectful.
3.5: If they don't know how to control their own families, how can they look after God's people?
3.6: They must not be new followers of the Lord. If they are, they might become proud and be doomed along with the devil.
3.7: Finally, they must be well-respected by people who are not followers. Then they won't be trapped and disgraced by the devil.
3.8: Church officers should be serious. They must not be liars, heavy drinkers, or greedy for money.
3.9: And they must have a clear conscience and hold firmly to what God has shown us about our faith.
3.10: They must first prove themselves. Then if no one has anything against them, they can serve as officers.
3.11: Women must also be serious. They must not gossip or be heavy drinkers, and they must be faithful in everything they do.
3.12: Church officers must be faithful in marriage. They must be in full control of their children and everyone else in their home.
3.13: Those who serve well as officers will earn a good reputation and will be highly respected for their faith in Christ Jesus.
3.14: I hope to visit you soon. But I am writing these instructions,
3.15: so if I am delayed, you will know how everyone who belongs to God's family ought to behave. After all, the church of the living God is the strong foundation of truth.
3.16: Here is the great mystery of our religion: Christ came as a human. The Spirit proved that he pleased God, and he was seen by angels. Christ was preached to the nations. People in this world put their faith in him, and he was taken up to glory.

4.1: God's Spirit clearly says that in the last days many people will turn from their faith. They will be fooled by evil spirits and by teachings that come from demons.
4.2: They will also be fooled by the false claims of liars whose consciences have lost all feeling. These liars
4.3: will forbid people to marry or to eat certain foods. But God created these foods to be eaten with thankful hearts by his followers who know the truth.
4.4: Everything God created is good. And if you give thanks, you may eat anything.
4.5: What God has said and your prayer will make it fit to eat.
4.6: If you teach these things to other followers, you will be a good servant of Christ Jesus. You will show you have grown up on the teachings about our faith and on the good instructions you have obeyed.
4.7: Don't have anything to do with worthless, senseless stories. Work hard to be truly religious.
4.10: We have put our hope in the living God, who is the Savior of everyone, but especially of those who have faith. This is why we work and struggle so hard.
4.11: Teach these things and tell everyone to do what you say.
4.12: Don't let anyone make fun of you, just because you are young. Set an example for other followers by what you say and do, as well as by your love, faith, and purity.
4.13: Until I arrive, be sure to keep on reading the Scriptures in worship, and don't stop preaching and teaching.
4.14: Use the gift you were given when the prophets spoke and the group of church leaders blessed you by placing their hands on you.
4.15: Remember these things and think about them, so everyone can see how well you are doing.
4.16: Be careful about the way you live and about what you teach. Keep on doing this, and you will save not only yourself, but the people who hear you.

5.1: Don't correct an older man. Encourage him, as you would your own father. Treat younger men as you would your own brother,
5.2: and treat older women as you would your own mother. Show the same respect to younger women that you would to your sister.
5.3: Take care of any widow who is really in need.
5.4: But if a widow has children or grandchildren, they should learn to serve God by taking care of her, as she once took care of them. This is what God wants them to do.
5.5: A widow who is really in need is one who doesn't have any relatives. She has faith in God, and she keeps praying to him night and day, asking for his help.
5.6: A widow who thinks only about having a good time is already dead, even though she is still alive.
5.7: Tell all this to everyone, so they will do the right thing.
5.8: People who don't take care of their relatives, and especially their own families, have given up their faith. They are worse than someone who doesn't have faith in the Lord.
5.9: For a widow to be put on the list of widows, she must be at least 60 years old, and she must have been faithful in marriage.
5.10: She must also be well-known for doing all sorts of good things, such as raising children, giving food to strangers, welcoming God's people into her home, helping people in need, and always making herself useful.
5.11: Don't put young widows on the list. They may later have a strong desire to get married. Then they will turn away from Christ
5.12: and become guilty of breaking their promise to him.
5.13: Besides, they will become lazy and get into the habit of going from house to house. Next, they will start gossiping and become busybodies, talking about things that are none of their business.
5.14: I would prefer that young widows get married, have children, and look after their families. Then the enemy won't have any reason to say insulting things about us.
5.15: Look what's already happened to some of the young widows! They have turned away to follow Satan.
5.16: If a woman who is a follower has any widows in her family, she should help them. This will keep the church from having that burden, and then the church can help widows who are really in need.
5.17: Church leaders who do their job well deserve to be paid twice as much, especially if they work hard at preaching and teaching.
5.18: It is just as the Scriptures say, "Don't muzzle an ox when you are using it to grind grain." You also know the saying, "Workers are worth their pay."
5.19: Don't listen to any charge against a church leader, unless at least two or three people bring the same charges.
5.20: But if any of the leaders should keep on sinning, they must be corrected in front of the whole group, as a warning to everyone else.
5.21: In the presence of God and Christ Jesus and their chosen angels, I order you to follow my instructions! Be fair with everyone, and don't have any favorites.
5.22: Don't be too quick to accept people into the service of the Lord by placing your hands on them. Don't sin because others do, but stay close to God.
5.23: Stop drinking only water. Take a little wine to help your stomach trouble and the other illnesses you often have.
5.24: Some people get caught in their sins almost at once, even before the time of judgment. But other people's sins don't show up until later.
5.25: It is the same with good deeds. Some are easily seen, but none of them can be hidden.

6.1: If you are a slave, you should respect and honor your owner. This will keep people from saying bad things about God and about our teaching.
6.2: If any of you slaves have owners who are followers, you should show them respect. After all, they are also followers of Christ, and he loves them. So you should serve and help them the best you can. These are the things you must teach and tell the people to do.
6.3: Anyone who teaches something different disagrees with the correct and godly teaching of our Lord Jesus Christ.
6.4: Those people who disagree are proud of themselves, but they don't really know a thing. Their minds are sick, and they like to argue over words. They cause jealousy, disagreements, unkind words, evil suspicions,
6.5: and nasty quarrels. They have wicked minds and have missed out on the truth. These people think religion is supposed to make you rich.
6.6: And religion does make your life rich, by making you content with what you have.
6.7: We didn't bring anything into this world, and we won't take anything with us when we leave.
6.8: So we should be satisfied just to have food and clothes.
6.9: People who want to be rich fall into all sorts of temptations and traps. They are caught by foolish and harmful desires that drag them down and destroy them.
6.10: The love of money causes all kinds of trouble. Some people want money so much they have given up their faith and caused themselves a lot of pain.
6.11: Timothy, you belong to God, so keep away from all these evil things. Try your best to please God and to be like him. Be faithful, loving, dependable, and gentle.
6.12: Fight a good fight for the faith and claim eternal life. God offered it to you when you clearly told about your faith, while so many people listened.
6.13: Now I ask you to make a promise. Make it in the presence of God, who gives life to all, and in the presence of Christ Jesus, who openly told Pontius Pilate about his faith.
6.14: Promise to obey completely and fully all that you have been told until our Lord Jesus Christ returns.
6.15: The glorious God is the only Ruler, the King of kings and Lord of lords. At the time that God has already decided, he will send Jesus Christ back again.
6.16: Only God lives forever! And he lives in light that no one can come near. No human has ever seen God or ever can see him. God will be honored, and his power will last forever. Amen.
6.17: Warn the rich people of this world not to be proud or to trust in wealth that is easily lost. Tell them to have faith in God, who is rich and blesses us with everything we need to enjoy life.
6.18: Instruct them to do as many good deeds as they can and to help everyone. Remind the rich to be generous and share what they have.
6.19: This will lay a solid foundation for the future, so they will know what true life is like.
6.20: Timothy, guard what God has placed in your care! Don't pay any attention to godless and stupid talk that sounds smart but really isn't.
6.21: Some people have even lost their faith by believing this talk. I pray that the Lord will be kind to all of you!

1.1: From Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus. God himself chose me to be an apostle, and he gave me the promised life that Jesus Christ makes possible.
1.2: Timothy, you are like a dear child to me. I pray that God our Father and our Lord Christ Jesus will be kind and merciful to you and will bless you with peace!
1.3: Night and day I mention you in my prayers. I am always grateful for you, as I pray to the God my ancestors and I have served with a clear conscience.
1.4: I remember how you cried, and I want to see you, because this would make me truly happy.
1.5: I also remember the genuine faith of your mother Eunice. Your grandmother Lois had the same sort of faith, and I am sure you have it as well.
1.6: So I ask you to make full use of the gift God gave you when I placed my hands on you. Use it well.
1.7: God's Spirit doesn't make cowards out of us. The Spirit gives us power, love, and self-control.
1.8: Don't be ashamed to speak for our Lord. And don't be ashamed of me, just because I am in jail for serving him. Use the power that comes from God and join with me in suffering for telling the good news.
1.9: God saved us and chose us to be his holy people. We did nothing to deserve this, but God planned it because he is so kind. Even before time began God planned for Christ Jesus to show kindness to us.
1.10: Now Christ Jesus has come to offer us God's gift of undeserved grace. Christ our Savior defeated death and brought us the good news. It shines like a light and offers life that never ends.
1.11: My work is to be a preacher, an apostle, and a teacher.
1.12: This is why I am suffering now. But I am not ashamed! I know the one I have faith in, and I am sure he can guard until the last day what he has trusted me with.
1.13: Now follow the example of the correct teaching I gave you, and let the faith and love of Christ Jesus be your model.
1.14: You have been trusted with a wonderful treasure. Guard it with the help of the Holy Spirit, who lives within us.
1.15: You know that everyone in Asia has turned against me, especially Phygelus and Hermogenes.
1.16: I pray that the Lord will be kind to the family of Onesiphorus. He often cheered me up and wasn't ashamed of me when I was put in jail.
1.17: Then after he arrived in Rome, he searched everywhere until he found me.
1.18: I pray that the Lord Jesus will ask God to show mercy to Onesiphorus on the day of judgment. You know how much he helped me in Ephesus.

2.1: Timothy, my child, you must let Christ Jesus make you strong by his gift of undeserved grace.
2.2: You have often heard me teach. Now I want you to tell these same things to followers who can be trusted to tell others.
2.3: As a good soldier of Christ Jesus you must endure your share of suffering.
2.4: Soldiers on duty don't work at outside jobs. They try only to please their commanding officer.
2.5: No one wins an athletic contest without obeying the rules.
2.6: And farmers who work hard are the first to eat what grows in their field.
2.7: If you keep in mind what I have told you, the Lord will help you understand completely.
2.8: Keep your mind on Jesus Christ! He was from the family of David and was raised from death, just as my good news says.
2.9: And because of this message, I am locked up in jail and treated like a criminal. But God's good news isn't locked in jail,
2.10: and so I am willing to put up with anything. Then God's special people will be saved and given eternal glory because they belong to Christ Jesus.
2.11: Here is a true message: "If we died with Christ, we will live with him.
2.12: If we don't give up, we will rule with him. If we deny that we know him, he will deny that he knows us.
2.13: If we are not faithful, he will still be faithful. Christ cannot deny who he is."
2.14: Don't let anyone forget these things. And with God as your witness, you must warn them not to argue about words. These arguments don't help anyone. In fact, they ruin everyone who listens to them.
2.15: Do your best to win God's approval as a worker who doesn't need to be ashamed and who teaches only the true message.
2.16: Keep away from worthless and useless talk. It only leads people farther away from God.
2.17: That sort of talk is like a sore that won't heal. And Hymenaeus and Philetus have been talking this way
2.18: by teaching that the dead have already been raised to life. This is far from the truth, and it is destroying the faith of some people.
2.20: In a large house some dishes are made of gold or silver, while others are made of wood or clay. Some of these are special, and others are not.
2.21: This is also how it is with people. The ones who stop doing evil and make themselves pure will become special. Their lives will be holy and pleasing to their Master, and they will be able to do all kinds of good deeds.
2.22: Run from temptations that capture young people. Always do the right thing. Be faithful, loving, and easy to get along with. Worship with people whose hearts are pure.
2.23: Stay away from stupid and senseless arguments. These only lead to trouble,
2.24: and God's servants must not be troublemakers. They must be kind to everyone, and they must be good teachers and very patient.
2.25: Be humble when you correct people who oppose you. Maybe God will lead them to turn to him and learn the truth.
2.26: They have been trapped by the devil, and he makes them obey him, but God may help them escape.

3.1: You can be certain that in the last days there will be some very hard times.
3.2: People will love only themselves and money. They will be proud, stuck-up, rude, and disobedient to their parents. They will also be ungrateful, godless,
3.3: heartless, and hateful. Their words will be cruel, and they will have no self-control or pity. These people will hate everything good.
3.4: They will be sneaky, reckless, and puffed up with pride. Instead of loving God, they will love pleasure.
3.5: Even though they will make a show of being religious, their religion won't be real. Don't have anything to do with such people.
3.6: Some men fool whole families, just to get power over those women who are slaves of sin and are controlled by all sorts of desires.
3.7: These women always want to learn something new, but they never can discover the truth.
3.8: Just as Jannes and Jambres opposed Moses, these people are enemies of the truth. Their minds are sick, and their faith isn't real.
3.9: But they won't get very far with their foolishness. Soon everyone will know the truth about them, just as Jannes and Jambres were found out.
3.10: Timothy, you know what I teach and how I live. You know what I want to do and what I believe. You have seen how patient and loving I am, and how in the past I put up with
3.11: trouble and suffering in the cities of Antioch, Iconium, and Lystra. Yet the Lord rescued me from all those terrible troubles.
3.12: In fact, anyone who belongs to Christ Jesus and wants to live right will have trouble from others.
3.13: But evil people who pretend to be what they are not will become worse than ever, as they fool others and are fooled themselves.
3.14: Keep on being faithful to what you were taught and to what you believed. After all, you know who taught you these things.
3.15: Since childhood, you have known the Holy Scriptures that are able to make you wise enough to have faith in Christ Jesus and be saved.
3.16: Everything in the Scriptures is God's Word. All of it is useful for teaching and helping people and for correcting them and showing them how to live.
3.17: The Scriptures train God's servants to do all kinds of good deeds.

4.1: When Christ Jesus comes as king, he will be the judge of everyone, whether they are living or dead. So with God and Christ as witnesses, I command you
4.2: to preach God's message. Do it willingly, even if it isn't the popular thing to do. You must correct people and point out their sins. But also cheer them up, and when you instruct them, always be patient.
4.3: The time is coming when people won't listen to good teaching. Instead, they will look for teachers who will please them by telling them only what they are itching to hear.
4.4: They will turn from the truth and eagerly listen to senseless stories.
4.5: But you must stay calm and be willing to suffer. You must work hard, telling the good news and to do your job well.
4.6: Now the time has come for me to die. My life is like a drink offering being poured out on the altar.
4.7: I have fought well. I have finished the race, and I have been faithful.
4.8: So a crown will be given to me for pleasing the Lord. He judges fairly, and on the day of judgment he will give a crown to me and to everyone else who wants him to appear with power.
4.9: Come to see me as soon as you can.
4.10: Demas loves the things of this world so much that he left me and went to Thessalonica. Crescens has gone to Galatia, and Titus has gone to Dalmatia.
4.11: Only Luke has stayed with me. Mark can be very helpful to me, so please find him and bring him with you.
4.12: I sent Tychicus to Ephesus.
4.13: When you come, bring the coat I left at Troas with Carpus. Don't forget to bring the scrolls, especially the ones made of leather.
4.14: Alexander, the metalworker, has hurt me in many ways. But the Lord will pay him back for what he has done.
4.15: Alexander opposes what we preach, so you had better watch out for him.
4.16: When I was first put on trial, no one helped me. In fact, everyone deserted me. I hope it won't be held against them.
4.17: But the Lord stood beside me. He gave me the strength to tell his full message, so that all Gentiles would hear it. And I was kept safe from hungry lions.
4.18: The Lord will always keep me from being harmed by evil, and he will bring me safely into his heavenly kingdom. Praise him forever and ever! Amen.
4.19: Give my greetings to Priscilla and Aquila and to the family of Onesiphorus.
4.20: Erastus stayed at Corinth. Trophimus was sick when I left him at Miletus.
4.21: Do your best to come before winter. Eubulus, Pudens, Linus, and Claudia send you their greetings, and so do the rest of the Lord's followers.
4.22: I pray that the Lord will bless your life and will be kind to you.

1.1: From Peter, an apostle of Jesus Christ. To God's people who are scattered like foreigners in Pontus, Galatia, Cappadocia, Asia, and Bithynia.
1.2: God the Father decided to choose you as his people, and his Spirit has made you holy. You have obeyed Jesus Christ and are sprinkled with his blood. I pray that God will be kind to you and will keep on giving you peace!
1.3: Praise God, the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ. God is so good, and by raising Jesus from death, he has given us new life and a hope that lives on.
1.4: God has something stored up for you in heaven, where it will never decay or be ruined or disappear.
1.5: You have faith in God, whose power will protect you until the last day. Then he will save you, just as he has always planned to do.
1.6: On that day you will be glad, even if you have to go through many hard trials for a while.
1.7: Your faith will be like gold that has been tested in a fire. And these trials will prove that your faith is worth much more than gold that can be destroyed. They will show that you will be given praise and honor and glory when Jesus Christ returns.
1.8: You have never seen Jesus, and you don't see him now. But still you love him and have faith in him, and no words can tell how glad and happy
1.9: you are to be saved. This is why you have faith.
1.10: Some prophets told how God would treat you with undeserved grace, and they searched hard to find out more about the way you would be saved.
1.11: The Spirit of Christ was in them and was telling them how Christ would suffer and would then be given great honor. So they searched to find out exactly who Christ would be and when this would happen.
1.12: But they were told that they were serving you and not themselves. They preached to you by the power of the Holy Spirit, who was sent from heaven. And their message was only for you, even though angels would like to know more about it.
1.13: Be alert and think straight. Put all your hope in how God will treat you with undeserved grace when Jesus Christ appears.
1.14: Behave like obedient children. Don't let your lives be controlled by your desires, as they used to be.
1.15: Always live as God's holy people should, because God is the one who chose you, and he is holy.
1.16: That's why the Scriptures say, "I am the holy God, and you must be holy too."
1.17: You say that God is your Father, but God doesn't have favorites! He judges all people by what they do. So you must honor God while you live as strangers here on earth.
1.18: You were rescued from the useless way of life you learned from your ancestors. But you know you were not rescued by such things as silver or gold that don't last forever.
1.19: You were rescued by the precious blood of Christ, that spotless and innocent lamb.
1.20: Christ was chosen even before the world was created, but because of you, he did not come until these last days.
1.21: And when he did come, it was to lead you to have faith in God, who raised him from death and honored him in a glorious way. This is why you have put your faith and hope in God.
1.22: You obeyed the truth, and your souls were made pure. Now you sincerely love each other. But you must keep on loving with all your heart.
1.23: Do this because God has given you new birth by his message that lives on forever.
1.25: But what the Lord has said will stand forever." Our good news to you is what the Lord has said.

2.1: Stop being hateful! Quit trying to fool people, and start being sincere. Don't be jealous or say cruel things about others.
2.2: Be like newborn babies who are thirsty for the pure spiritual milk that will help you grow and be saved.
2.3: You have already found out how good the Lord really is.
2.4: Come to Jesus Christ. He is the living stone people have rejected, but which God has chosen and highly honored.
2.5: And now you are living stones being used to build a spiritual house. You are also a group of holy priests, and with the help of Jesus Christ you will offer sacrifices that please God.
2.6: It is just as God says in the Scriptures, "Look! I am placing in Zion a choice and precious cornerstone. No one who has faith in this one will be disappointed."
2.7: You are followers of the Lord, and this stone is precious to you. But it isn't precious to those who refuse to follow him. They are the builders who tossed aside the stone that turned out to be the most important one of all.
2.9: But you are God's chosen and special people. You are a group of royal priests and a holy nation. God has brought you out of darkness into his marvelous light. Now you must tell all the wonderful things he has done. The Scriptures say,
2.10: "Once you were nobody. Now you are God's people. At one time no one had mercy on you. Now God has treated you with kindness."
2.11: Dear friends, you are foreigners and strangers on this earth. So I beg you not to surrender to those desires that fight against you.
2.12: Always let others see you behaving properly, even though they may still accuse you of doing wrong. Then on the day of judgment, they will honor God by telling the good things they saw you do.
2.13: The Lord wants you to obey all human authorities, especially the Emperor, who rules over everyone.
2.14: You must also obey governors, because they are sent by the Emperor to punish criminals and to praise good citizens.
2.15: God wants you to silence stupid and ignorant people by doing right.
2.16: You are free, but still you are God's servants, and you must not use your freedom as an excuse for doing wrong.
2.17: Respect everyone and show special love for God's people. Honor God and respect the Emperor.
2.18: Servants, you must obey your masters and always show respect to them. Do this, not only to those who are kind and thoughtful, but also to those who are cruel.
2.19: God will bless you, even if others treat you unfairly for being loyal to him.
2.20: You don't gain anything by being punished for some wrong you have done. But God will bless you, if you have to suffer for doing something good.
2.21: After all, God chose you to suffer as you follow in the footsteps of Christ, who set an example by suffering for you.
2.22: Christ did not sin or ever tell a lie.
2.23: Although he was abused, he never tried to get even. And when he suffered, he made no threats. Instead, he had faith in God, who judges fairly.
2.24: Christ carried the burden of our sins. He was nailed to the cross, so we would stop sinning and start living right. By his cuts and bruises you are healed.
2.25: You had wandered away like sheep. Now you have returned to the one who is your shepherd and protector.

3.1: If you are a wife, you must put your husband first. Even if he opposes our message, you will win him over by what you do. No one else will have to say anything to him,
3.2: because he will see how you honor God and live a pure life.
3.3: Don't depend on things like fancy hairdos or gold jewelry or expensive clothes to make you look beautiful.
3.4: Be beautiful in your heart by being gentle and quiet. This kind of beauty will last, and God considers it very special.
3.5: Long ago those women who worshiped God and put their hope in him made themselves beautiful by putting their husbands first.
3.6: For example, Sarah obeyed Abraham and called him her master. You are her true children, if you do right and don't let anything frighten you.
3.7: If you are a husband, you should be thoughtful of your wife. Treat her with honor, because she isn't as strong as you are, and she shares with you in the gift of life. Then nothing will stand in the way of your prayers.
3.8: Finally, all of you should agree and have concern and love for each other. You should also be kind and humble.
3.9: Don't be hateful and insult people just because they are hateful and insult you. Instead, treat everyone with kindness. You are God's chosen ones, and he will bless you. The Scriptures say,
3.10: "Do you really love life? Do you want to be happy? Then stop saying cruel things and quit telling lies.
3.11: Give up your evil ways and do right, as you find and follow the road to peace.
3.12: The Lord watches over everyone who obeys him, and he listens to their prayers. But he opposes everyone who does evil."
3.13: Can anyone really harm you for being eager to do good deeds?
3.14: Even if you have to suffer for doing good things, God will bless you. So stop being afraid and don't worry about what people might do.
3.15: Honor Christ and let him be the Lord of your life. Always be ready to give an answer when someone asks you about your hope.
3.16: Give a kind and respectful answer and keep your conscience clear. This way you will make people ashamed for saying bad things about your good conduct as a follower of Christ.
3.17: You are better off to obey God and suffer for doing right than to suffer for doing wrong.
3.18: Christ died once for our sins. An innocent person died for those who are guilty. Christ did this to bring you to God, when his body was put to death and his spirit was made alive.
3.19: Christ then preached to the spirits that were being kept in prison.
3.20: They had disobeyed God while Noah was building the boat, but God had been patient with them. Eight people went into that boat and were brought safely through the flood.
3.21: Those flood waters were like baptism that now saves you. But baptism is more than just washing your body. It means turning to God with a clear conscience, because Jesus Christ was raised from death.
3.22: Christ is now in heaven, where he sits at the right side of God. All angels, authorities, and powers are under his control.

4.1: Christ suffered here on earth. Now you must be ready to suffer as he did, because suffering shows that you have stopped sinning.
4.2: It means you have turned from your own desires and want to obey God for the rest of your life.
4.3: You have already lived long enough like people who don't know God. You were immoral and followed your evil desires. You went around drinking and partying and carrying on. In fact, you even worshiped disgusting idols.
4.4: Now your former friends wonder why you have stopped running around with them, and they curse you for it.
4.5: But they will have to answer to God, who judges the living and the dead.
4.6: The good news has even been preached to the dead, so that after they have been judged for what they have done in this life, their spirits will live with God.
4.7: Everything will soon come to an end. So be serious and be sensible enough to pray.
4.8: Most important of all, you must sincerely love each other, because love wipes away many sins.
4.9: Welcome people into your home and don't grumble about it.
4.10: Each of you has been blessed with one of God's many wonderful gifts to be used in the service of others. So use your gift well.
4.11: If you have the gift of speaking, preach God's message. If you have the gift of helping others, do it with the strength that God supplies. Everything should be done in a way that will bring honor to God because of Jesus Christ, who is glorious and powerful forever. Amen.
4.12: Dear friends, don't be surprised or shocked that you are going through testing that is like walking through fire.
4.13: Be glad for the chance to suffer as Christ suffered. It will prepare you for even greater happiness when he makes his glorious return.
4.14: Count it a blessing when you suffer for being a Christian. This shows that God's glorious Spirit is with you.
4.15: But you deserve to suffer if you are a murderer, a thief, a crook, or a busybody.
4.16: Don't be ashamed to suffer for being a Christian. Praise God that you belong to him.
4.17: God has already begun judging his own people. And if his judgment begins with us, imagine how terrible it will be for those who refuse to obey his message. The Scriptures say,
4.18: "If good people barely escape, what will happen to sinners and to others who don't respect God?"
4.19: If you suffer for obeying God, you must have complete faith in your faithful Creator and keep on doing right.

5.1: Church leaders, I am writing to encourage you. I too am a leader, as well as a witness to Christ's suffering, and I will share in his glory when it is shown to us.
5.2: Just as shepherds watch over their sheep, you must watch over everyone God has placed in your care. Do it willingly in order to please God, and not simply because you think you must. Let it be something you want to do, instead of something you do merely to make money.
5.3: Don't be bossy to those people who are in your care, but set an example for them.
5.4: Then when Christ the Chief Shepherd returns, you will be given a crown that will never lose its glory.
5.5: All of you young people should obey your elders. In fact, everyone should be humble toward everyone else. The Scriptures say, "God opposes proud people, but he helps everyone who is humble."
5.6: Be humble in the presence of God's mighty power, and he will honor you when the time comes.
5.7: God cares for you, so turn all your worries over to him.
5.8: Be on your guard and stay awake. Your enemy, the devil, is like a roaring lion, sneaking around to find someone to attack.
5.9: But you must resist the devil and stay strong in your faith. You know that all over the world the Lord's followers are suffering just as you are.
5.10: But God shows undeserved kindness to everyone. That's why he appointed Christ Jesus to choose you to share in his eternal glory. You will suffer for a while, but God will make you complete, steady, strong, and firm.
5.11: God will be in control forever! Amen.
5.12: Silvanus helped me write this short letter, and I consider him a faithful follower of the Lord. I wanted to encourage you and tell you how kind God really is, so you will keep on having faith in him.
5.13: Greetings from the Lord's followers in Babylon. They are God's chosen ones. Mark, who is like a son to me, sends his greetings too.
5.14: Give each other a warm greeting. I pray that God will give peace to everyone who belongs to Christ.

1.1: From Simon Peter, a servant and an apostle of Jesus Christ. To everyone who shares with us in the privilege of believing that our God and Savior Jesus Christ will do what is just and fair.
1.2: I pray that God will be kind to you and will let you live in perfect peace! May you keep learning more and more about God and our Lord Jesus.
1.3: We have everything we need to live a life that pleases God. It was all given to us by God's own power, when we learned he had invited us to share in his wonderful goodness.
1.4: God made great and marvelous promises, so his nature would become part of us. Then we could escape our evil desires and the corrupt influences of this world.
1.5: Do your best to improve your faith by adding goodness, understanding,
1.6: self-control, patience, devotion to God,
1.7: concern for others, and love.
1.8: If you keep growing in this way, it will show that what you know about our Lord Jesus Christ has made your lives useful and meaningful.
1.9: But if you don't grow, you are like someone who is nearsighted or blind, and you have forgotten that your past sins are forgiven.
1.10: My friends, you must do all you can to show God has really chosen and selected you. If you keep on doing this, you won't stumble and fall.
1.11: Then our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ will give you a glorious welcome into his kingdom that will last forever.
1.12: You are holding firmly to the truth you were given. But I am still going to remind you of these things.
1.13: In fact, I think I should keep on reminding you until I leave this body.
1.14: And our Lord Jesus Christ has already told me that I will soon leave it behind.
1.15: This is why I am doing my best to make sure that each of you remembers all of this after I am gone.
1.16: When we told you about the power and the return of our Lord Jesus Christ, we were not telling clever stories someone had made up. But with our own eyes we saw his true greatness.
1.17: God, our great and wonderful Father, truly honored him by saying, "This is my own dear Son, and I am pleased with him."
1.18: We were there with Jesus on the holy mountain and heard this voice speak from heaven.
1.19: All of this makes us even more certain that what the prophets said is true. So you should pay close attention to their message, as you would to a lamp shining in some dark place. You must keep on paying attention until daylight comes and the morning star rises in your hearts.
1.20: But you need to realize that no one alone can understand any of the prophecies in the Scriptures.
1.21: The prophets did not think these things up on their own, but they were guided by the Spirit of God.

2.1: Sometimes false prophets spoke to the people of Israel. False teachers will also sneak in and speak harmful lies to you. But these teachers don't really belong to the Master who paid a great price for them, and they will quickly destroy themselves.
2.2: Many people will follow their evil ways and cause others to tell lies about the true way.
2.3: They will be greedy and cheat you with smooth talk. But long ago God decided to punish them, and God doesn't sleep.
2.4: God did not have pity on the angels that sinned. He had them tied up and thrown into the dark pits of hell until the time of judgment.
2.5: And during Noah's time, God did not have pity on the ungodly people of the world. He destroyed them with a flood, though he did save eight people, including Noah, who preached the truth.
2.6: God punished the cities of Sodom and Gomorrah by burning them to ashes, and this is a warning to anyone else who wants to sin.
2.9: This shows that the Lord knows how to rescue godly people from their sufferings and to punish evil people while they wait for the day of judgment.
2.10: The Lord is especially hard on people who disobey him and don't think of anything except their own filthy desires. They are reckless and proud and are not afraid of cursing the glorious beings in heaven.
2.11: Although angels are more powerful than these evil beings, even the angels don't dare to accuse them to the Lord.
2.12: These people are no better than senseless animals that live by their feelings and are born to be caught and killed. They speak evil of things they don't know anything about. But their own corrupt deeds will destroy them.
2.13: They have done evil, and they will be rewarded with evil. They think it is fun to have wild parties during the day. They are immoral, and the meals they eat with you are spoiled by the shameful and selfish way they carry on.
2.14: All they think about is having sex with someone else's husband or wife. There is no end to their wicked deeds. They trick people who are easily fooled, and their minds are filled with greedy thoughts. But they are headed for trouble!
2.15: They have left the true road and have gone down the wrong path by following the example of the prophet Balaam. He was the son of Beor and loved what he got from being a crook.
2.16: But a donkey corrected him for this evil deed. It spoke to him with a human voice and made him stop his foolishness.
2.17: These people are like dried up water holes and clouds blown by a windstorm. The darkest part of hell is waiting for them.
2.18: They brag out loud about their stupid nonsense. And by being vulgar and crude, they trap people who have barely escaped from living the wrong kind of life.
2.19: They promise freedom to everyone. But they are merely slaves of filthy living, because people are slaves of whatever controls them.
2.20: When they learned about our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ, they escaped from the filthy things of this world. But they are again caught up and controlled by these filthy things, and now they are in worse shape than they were at first.
2.21: They would have been better off if they had never known about the right way. Even after they knew what was right, they turned their backs on the holy commandments they were given.

3.1: My dear friends, this is the second letter I have written to encourage you to do some honest thinking. I don't want you to forget
3.2: what God's prophets said would happen. You must never forget what the holy prophets taught in the past. And you must remember what the apostles told you our Lord and Savior has commanded us to do.
3.3: But first you must realize that in the last days some people won't think about anything except their own selfish desires. They will make fun of you
3.4: and say, "Didn't your Lord promise to come back? Yet the first leaders have already died, and the world hasn't changed a bit."
3.5: They will say this because they want to forget that long ago the heavens and the earth were made at God's command. The earth came out of water and was made from water.
3.6: Later it was destroyed by the waters of a mighty flood.
3.7: But God has commanded the present heavens and earth to remain until the day of judgment. Then they will be set on fire, and ungodly people will be destroyed.
3.8: Dear friends, don't forget that for the Lord one day is the same as 1,000 years, and 1,000 years is the same as one day.
3.9: The Lord isn't slow about keeping his promises, as some people think he is. In fact, God is patient, because he wants everyone to turn from sin and no one to be lost.
3.10: The day of the Lord's return will surprise us like a thief. The heavens will disappear with a loud noise, and the heat will melt the whole universe. Then the earth and everything on it will be seen for what they are.
3.11: Everything will be destroyed. So you should serve and honor God by the way you live.
3.12: You should look forward to the day when God judges everyone, and you should try to make it come soon. On that day the heavens will be destroyed by fire, and everything else will melt in the heat.
3.13: But God has promised us a new heaven and a new earth, where justice will rule. We are really looking forward to this!
3.14: My friends, while you are waiting, you should make certain the Lord finds you pure, spotless, and living at peace.
3.15: Don't forget that the Lord is patient because he wants people to be saved. This is also what our dear friend Paul said when he wrote you with the wisdom God had given him.
3.16: Paul talks about these same things in all his letters, but part of what he says is hard to understand. Some ignorant and unsteady people even destroy themselves by twisting what he said. They do the same thing with other Scriptures too.
3.17: My dear friends, you have been warned ahead of time! So don't let the errors of evil people lead you down the wrong path and make you lose your balance.
3.18: Let the gift of undeserved grace and the understanding that come from our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ help you keep on growing. Praise Jesus now and forever! Amen.

1.1: The Word that gives life was from the beginning, and this is the one our message is about. Our ears have heard, our eyes have seen, and our hands have touched this Word.
1.2: The one who gives life appeared! We saw it happen, and we are witnesses to what we have seen. Now we are telling you about this eternal life that was with the Father and appeared to us.
1.3: We are telling you what we have seen and heard, so you may share in this life with us. And we share in it with the Father and with his Son Jesus Christ.
1.4: We are writing to tell you these things, because this makes us truly happy.
1.5: Jesus told us God is light and doesn't have any darkness in him. Now we are telling you.
1.6: If we say we share in life with God and keep on living in the dark, we are lying and are not living by the truth.
1.7: But if we live in the light, as God does, we share in life with each other. And the blood of his Son Jesus washes all our sins away.
1.8: If we say we have not sinned, we are fooling ourselves, and the truth isn't in our hearts.
1.9: But if we confess our sins to God, he can always be trusted to forgive us and take our sins away.
1.10: If we say we have not sinned, we make God a liar, and his message isn't in our hearts.

2.1: My children, I am writing this so you won't sin. But if you do sin, Jesus Christ always does the right thing, and he will speak to the Father for us.
2.2: Christ is the sacrifice that takes away our sins and the sins of all the world's people.
2.3: When we obey God, we are sure we know him.
2.4: But if we claim to know him and don't obey him, we are lying and the truth isn't in our hearts.
2.5: We truly love God only when we obey him as we should, and then we know we belong to him.
2.6: If we say we are his, we must follow the example of Christ.
2.7: My dear friends, I am not writing to give you a new commandment. It is the same one you were first given, and it is the message you heard.
2.8: But it really is a new commandment, and you know its true meaning, just as Christ does. You can see the darkness fading away and the true light already shining.
2.9: If we claim to be in the light and hate someone, we are still in the dark.
2.10: But if we love others, we are in the light, and we don't cause problems for them.
2.11: If we hate others, we are living and walking in the dark. We don't know where we are going, because we can't see in the dark.
2.12: Children, I am writing you, because your sins have been forgiven in the name of Christ.
2.13: Parents, I am writing you, because you have known the one who was there from the beginning. Young people, I am writing you, because you have defeated the evil one.
2.14: Children, I am writing you, because you have known the Father. Parents, I am writing you, because you have known the one who was there from the beginning. Young people, I am writing you, because you are strong. God's message is firm in your hearts, and you have defeated the evil one.
2.15: Don't love the world or anything that belongs to the world. If you love the world, you cannot love the Father.
2.16: Our foolish pride comes from this world, and so do our selfish desires and our desire to have everything we see. None of this comes from the Father.
2.17: The world and the desires it causes are disappearing. But if we obey God, we will live forever.
2.18: Children, this is the last hour. You heard that the enemy of Christ would appear at this time, and many of Christ's enemies have already appeared. So we know the last hour is here.
2.19: These people came from our own group, yet they were not really part of us. If they had been part of us, they would have stayed with us. But they left, which proves they did not belong to our group.
2.20: Christ, the Holy One, has blessed you, and now all of you understand.
2.21: I did not need to write you about the truth, since you already know it. You also know that liars do not belong to the truth.
2.22: And a liar is anyone who says Jesus isn't truly Christ. Anyone who says this is an enemy of Christ and rejects both the Father and the Son.
2.23: If we reject the Son, we reject the Father. But if we say we accept the Son, we have the Father.
2.24: Keep thinking about the message you first heard, and you will always be one in your heart with the Son and with the Father.
2.25: The Son has promised us eternal life.
2.26: I am writing to warn you about those people who are misleading you.
2.27: But Christ has blessed you with the Holy Spirit. Now the Spirit stays in you, and you don't need any teachers. The Spirit is truthful and teaches you everything. So stay one in your heart with Christ, just as the Spirit has taught you to do.
2.28: Children, stay one in your hearts with Christ. Then when he returns, we will have confidence and won't have to hide in shame.
2.29: You know Christ always does right and everyone who does right is a child of God.

3.1: Think how much the Father loves us. He loves us so much that he lets us be called his children, as we truly are. But since the people of this world did not know who Christ is, they don't know who we are.
3.2: My dear friends, we are already God's children, though what we will be hasn't yet been seen. But we do know when Christ returns, we will be like him, because we will see him as he truly is.
3.3: This hope makes us keep ourselves holy, just as Christ is holy.
3.4: Everyone who sins breaks God's law, because sin is the same as breaking God's law.
3.5: You know Christ came to take away our sins. He isn't sinful,
3.6: and people who stay one in their hearts with him won't keep on sinning. If they do keep on sinning, they don't know Christ, and they have never seen him.
3.7: Children, don't be fooled. Anyone who does right is good, just like Christ himself.
3.8: Anyone who keeps on sinning belongs to the devil. He has sinned from the beginning, but the Son of God came to destroy all that he has done.
3.9: God's children cannot keep on being sinful. His life-giving power lives in them and makes them his children, so they cannot keep on sinning.
3.10: You can tell God's children from the devil's children, because those who belong to the devil refuse to do right or to love each other.
3.11: From the beginning you were told we must love each other.
3.12: Don't be like Cain, who belonged to the devil and murdered his own brother. Why did he murder him? He did it because his brother was good, and he was evil.
3.13: My friends, don't be surprised if the people of this world hate you.
3.14: Our love for each other proves we have gone from death to life. But if you don't love each other, you are still under the power of death.
3.15: If you hate each other, you are murderers, and we know murderers do not have eternal life.
3.16: We know what love is because Jesus gave his life for us. This is why we must give our lives for each other.
3.17: If we have all we need and see one of our own people in need, we must have pity on that person, or else we cannot say we love God.
3.18: Children, you show love for others by truly helping them, and not merely by talking about it.
3.19: When we love others, we know we belong to the truth, and we feel at ease in the presence of God.
3.20: But even if we don't feel at ease, God is greater than our feelings, and he knows everything.
3.21: Dear friends, if we feel at ease in the presence of God, we will have the courage to come near him.
3.22: He will give us whatever we ask, because we obey him and do what pleases him.
3.23: God wants us to have faith in his Son Jesus Christ and to love each other. This is also what Jesus taught us to do.
3.24: If we obey God's commandments, we will stay one in our hearts with him, and he will stay one with us. The Spirit he has given us is proof that we are one with him.

4.1: Dear friends, don't believe everyone who claims to have the Spirit of God. Test them all to find out if they really do come from God. Many false prophets have already gone out into the world,
4.2: and you can know which ones come from God. His Spirit says that Jesus Christ had a truly human body.
4.3: But when someone doesn't say this about Jesus, you know this person has a spirit that doesn't come from God and is the enemy of Christ. You knew this enemy was coming into the world and now is already here.
4.4: Children, you belong to God, and you have defeated these enemies. God's Spirit is in you and is more powerful than the one who is in the world.
4.5: These enemies belong to this world, and the world listens to them, because they speak its language.
4.6: We belong to God, and everyone who knows God will listen to us. But the people who don't know God won't listen to us. This is how we can tell the Spirit that speaks the truth from the one that tells lies.
4.7: My dear friends, we must love each other. Love comes from God, and when we love each other, it shows we have been given new life. We are now God's children, and we know him.
4.8: God is love, and anyone who doesn't love others has never known him.
4.9: God showed his love for us when he sent his only Son into the world to give us life.
4.10: Real love isn't our love for God, but his love for us. God sent his Son to be the sacrifice by which our sins are forgiven.
4.11: Dear friends, since God loved us this much, we must love each other.
4.12: No one has ever seen God. But if we love each other, God lives in us, and his love is truly in our hearts.
4.13: God has given us his Spirit. This is how we know we are one with him, just as he is one with us.
4.14: God sent his Son to be the Savior of the world. We saw his Son and are now telling others about him.
4.15: God stays one with everyone who openly says Jesus is the Son of God. This is how we stay one with God
4.16: and are sure God loves us. God is love. If we keep on loving others, we will stay one in our hearts with God, and he will stay one with us.
4.17: If we truly love others and live as Christ did in this world, we won't be worried about the day of judgment.
4.18: A real love for others will chase those worries away. The thought of being punished is what makes us afraid. It shows we have not really learned to love.
4.19: We love because God loved us first.
4.20: But if we say we love God and don't love each other, we are liars. We cannot see God. So how can we love God, if we don't love the people we can see?
4.21: The commandment that God has given us is: "Love God and love each other!"

5.1: If we believe Jesus is truly Christ, we are God's children. Everyone who loves the Father will also love his children.
5.2: If we love and obey God, we know we will love his children.
5.3: We show our love for God by obeying his commandments, and they are not hard to follow.
5.4: Every child of God can defeat the world, and our faith is what gives us this victory.
5.5: No one can defeat the world without having faith in Jesus as the Son of God.
5.6: Water and blood came out from the side of Jesus Christ. It wasn't just water, but water and blood. The Spirit tells about this, because the Spirit is truthful.
5.7: In fact, there are three who tell about it.
5.8: They are the Spirit, the water, and the blood, and they all agree.
5.9: We believe what people tell us. But we can trust what God says even more, and God is the one who has spoken about his Son.
5.10: If we have faith in God's Son, we have believed what God has said. But if we don't believe what God has said about his Son, it is the same as calling God a liar.
5.11: God has also said he gave us eternal life and this life comes to us from his Son.
5.12: And so, if we have God's Son, we have this life. But if we don't have the Son, we don't have this life.
5.13: All of you have faith in the Son of God, and I have written to let you know you have eternal life.
5.14: We are certain God will hear our prayers when we ask for what pleases him.
5.15: And if we know God listens when we pray, we are sure our prayers have already been answered.
5.16: Suppose you see one of our people commit a sin that isn't a deadly sin. You can pray, and this person will be given eternal life. But the sin must not be one that is deadly.
5.17: Everything that is wrong is sin, but not all sins are deadly.
5.18: We are sure God's children do not keep on sinning. God's own Son protects them, and the devil cannot harm them.
5.19: We are certain we come from God and the rest of the world is under the power of the devil.
5.20: We know that Jesus Christ the Son of God has come and has shown us the true God. And because of Jesus, we now belong to the true God who gives eternal life.
5.21: Children, you must stay away from idols.

1.1: From the church leader. To a very special woman and her children. I truly love all of you, and so does everyone else who knows the truth.
1.2: We love you because the truth is now in our hearts, and it will be there forever.
1.3: I pray that God the Father and Jesus Christ his Son will be kind and merciful to us! May they give us peace and truth and love.
1.4: I was very glad to learn that some of your children are obeying the truth, as the Father told us to do.
1.5: Dear friend, I am not writing to tell you and your children to do something you have not done before. I am writing to tell you to love each other, which is the first thing you were told to do.
1.6: Love means we do what God tells us. And from the beginning, he told you to love him.
1.7: Many liars have gone out into the world. These deceitful liars are saying Jesus Christ did not have a truly human body. But they are liars and the enemies of Christ.
1.8: So be sure not to lose what we have worked for. If you do, you won't be given your full reward.
1.9: Don't keep changing what you were taught about Christ, or else God will no longer be with you. But if you hold firmly to what you were taught, both the Father and the Son will be with you.
1.10: If people won't agree to this teaching, don't welcome them into your home or even greet them.
1.11: Greeting them is the same as taking part in their evil deeds.
1.12: I have much more to tell you, but I don't want to write it with pen and ink. I want to come and talk to you in person, because this will make us really happy.
1.13: Greetings from the children of your very special sister.

1.1: From the church leader. To my dear friend Gaius. I love you because we follow the truth,
1.2: dear friend, and I pray all goes well for you. I hope you are as strong in body, as I know you are in spirit.
1.3: It makes me very happy when the Lord's followers come by and speak openly of how you obey the truth.
1.4: Nothing brings me greater happiness than to hear that my children are obeying the truth.
1.5: Dear friend, you have always been faithful in helping other followers of the Lord, even the ones you didn't know before.
1.6: They have told the church about your love. They say you were good enough to welcome them and to send them on their mission in a way God's servants deserve.
1.7: When they left to tell others about the Lord, they decided not to accept help from anyone who wasn't a follower.
1.8: We must support people like them, so we can take part in what they are doing to spread the truth.
1.9: I wrote to the church. But Diotrephes likes to be the number-one leader, and he won't pay any attention to us.
1.10: So if I come, I will remind him of how he has been attacking us with gossip. Not only has he been doing this, but he refuses to welcome any of the Lord's followers who come by. And when other church members want to welcome them, he puts them out of the church.
1.11: Dear friend, don't imitate the evil deeds of others, but follow the example of people who do kind deeds. They are God's children, but those who are always doing evil have never seen God.
1.12: Everyone speaks well of Demetrius, and so does the true message that he teaches. I also speak well of him, and you know what I say is true.
1.13: I have much more to say to you, but I don't want to write it with pen and ink.
1.14: I hope to see you soon, and then we can talk in person. 15 I pray that God will bless you with peace! Your friends send their greetings. Please give a personal greeting to each of our friends.
